Reviews.Title: “Great room, good facility but..”
Reviews.Author: TravisB4r
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel with family of 5. Overall satisfied but I think the hotel is too 'materialistic', I'll be talking more about it later. Strategically located on conviniently and closed to famous Singapore shopping centre and food courts so shopping and dining is easy! Room is spacious and clean with complete amenities like hair dryer, iron, safety box, etc. You can even request for different type of pillow! My fav is the water-filled pillow! My only complaint would be it price! I paid over SGP350 per night for the room but didnt get breakfast and internet connection which should be free for this kind of hotel. Breakfast cost me another 28 dollar per person (food also not recommended) and 30 something for the internet connection! Overall I enjoy my stay in Holiday Inn but would only come back if the provide better value for money for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Retno M
Reviews.Content: Staying on weekend for the airshow. Staff were excellent, friendly n helpfull. Knowledgeable of what's going on the city. Convenient location as it's very close to Orchard. I left my hat in the taxy, and very surprised when the concierge returned it in the evening :)

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: BWS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in April 2012. We stayed in a king bed deluxe suite which had a separate lounge room from the bedroom. It was very spacious and large for the 3 of us. The hotel is spotlessly clean and very well presented. There was a minor hiccup on check in, but that was quickly resolved. Everyone is eager to please. We stayed in room 522 which was at the rear of the hotel and looked out at Cuppage Plaza. The view isn’t much to speak of. Cuppage Plaza has a great laundry store which only charged 12SGD for a bag of washing, very cheap, quick and efficient. We had use of the Executive lounge which is well worth. Along with breakfast in the morning either in the lounge or main restaurant, there was afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapés. It is very well run and the ladies there are excellent, Service is first class. The room was very comfortable and the amenities were great. We made use of the small gym and pool area. The pool was nice after a long day shopping. The gym is very small and was well attended on most days. All in all our stay was most enjoyable and we would return without doubt. Value for money, for Singapore and the three of us was well worth it. The hotel is very well run, the service is first class, and we enjoyed ourselves there. Orchard Road and the MRT rail system is a very short walk away from the hotel. We were staying there as part of our 20th wedding celebrations. We were surprised with a delicious cake, bottle of champagne and chocolates on the first day, a very welcome and greatly appreciated gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: LAR60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of November 2011 for 1 week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our son was 17 years old at the time and stayed for free (children are considered to be up to 17 years of age). Also it is great for him to have a real bed also instead of a rollaway. There were two very comfortable double beds. I am quite particular about beds and these were very supportive but not like concrete and no sagging. The choice of both soft and firm pillows in the room is good too. The room was quite spacious and there was a desk chair plus a comfy lounge chair. Our room was on the highway side with a view to the jungle-like park on the other side. I thought that the hum of traffic would intrude during the night but it did not. (We stayed here for 1 night a couple of years ago and our room was on the other side of the hotel and the sound of night revelry did intrude). The hotel supplies bottled water each day - we rarely needed to buy any. On arrival we were welcomed most hospitably - all the staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was most enjoyable and we ended up signing up for breakfast for each morning in advance which then saved some money. We had dinner in the same setting one evening at their buffet - it was very busy and noisy. The food was quite good and the value average. We also ate one evening in their Indian restaurant which was absolutely delicious. Generally we ate out and the hotel is conveniently located opposite the Cuppage Centre along which are numerous restaurants with both indoor and outdoor seating. Also Orchard Road is only a block away via the Cuppage Centre and here you will also find an MTR station. Being one block back from the razzle dazzle of Orchard Road is also calming. The roof top swimming pool is very private and inviting. It is also a good length for laps which is a good way to soothe sore muscles from all the walking. If we stay in Singapore in the future I would not look elsewhere for accommodation - I would automatically book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: ChasingSunshine
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms with double beds for three nights. Both rooms were on the 3rd floor and were clean and comfortable. I did see a few ants in the bathroom, but it wasn't a big deal. We ate at the hotel's breakfast buffet which had enough variety to suit us and it was convenient to do that before we got ready to start sightseeing. I visited the roof top pool one afternoon and people were swimming and lounging beside it. I went back at 9:30 PM and there were just a couple people in the hot tub and a few kids playing in the kiddie pool. I saw the gym too, which isn't very large, but it did have several machines. The thing I liked best was that there were lots of places to eat and to shop within minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: resa b
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel everthing we had read about it . great service and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelMom
Reviews.Content: Our family if 4 just spent 5 nights in Singapore and loved this hotel. Conveniently located to all the shopping on Orchard Rd but also only a very short cab ride to Chinatown or Marina Bay Sands. Very nice decor in the rooms and public areas. Extremely comfortable beds and pillows! The best part was the customer service: we arrived very late at night and were met with smiles and speedy check-in. The kids loved the chocolates on the pillows every evening! But most of all, on our last day, we arrived at the airport and realized we had left the passports in the room. I called the hotel and spoke to Mary at Guest Services and she quickly organized someone to retrieve the passports and get them into a taxi to us at the airport. Within 45 minutes of my call, we had passports in hand and were on our way home. So simple! Would definitely stay here again. One improvement would be wifi or a slightly less expensive fee for Internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Mac1963
Reviews.Content: I am very hard to please and extremely fussy but on a bit of a budget at the end of a very expensive stay in Australia so chose a Holiday Inn hotel, expecting it to be average/good. However we where very pleasantly surprised that the standard was much highter and I now can't speak highly enough of this hotel and its staff who made our stay truly memorable. The photos do not do it justice, as soon as we arrived we where all impressed with the foyer, lobby and all communal areas, everything is very plush. We had two rooms for five of us and both rooms where lovely, no balconies which we thought where a dissapointment at first but soon realised that Singapore is just too hot and humid to be bothered sitting on one so not a dissadvantage at all. We had the facilities of the executive rooms so benefitted from breakfast in quieter more plush surroundings although the normal restaurant was fine. We also had afternoon tea and canapes early evening, all this and drinks included in the price along with free wi fi. The pool is lovely, just a nice temperature, I hate the water being too cold and the sun loungers where so thick and very comfy . All the staff, from reception, bar, restaurant, door men, porters, absolutely everyone where the most proffessional and courteous staff we have ever come accross, and we are all quite well travelled. At the end of our stay we where even waved off and it wasnt because they where glad to see the back of us!! Myself and our daughters where very moved and sad to go so much so that even after visiting The famous Raffles hotel, which was incredible and The gorgeous Fullerton, I think the next time any of us visit Singapore again we would rebook The Holiday Inn, especially as it is so good value for money and in an ideal, central location, We all agree that all in all it is very, very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel close to City Centre”
Reviews.Author: vpsharma
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Hotel in Orchard City Centre, Singapore is ideally located for tourists and business visitors alike.The rooms are spacious, well furnished and impeccably maintained. Service quality of Holiday Inn Hotels is consistently good all over and this one confirms the same. The Tandoor - its North Indian Specialty Restaurant, is quite good. The only observation I have is that its price is costlier and not in line with other Holiday Inn Hotels .... maybe because Singapore, as such, for this category of Hotels is costly!

Reviews.Title: “2 rooms for 4 nights for the family of 4”
Reviews.Author: skuffs
Reviews.Content: The rooms were and nice clean. The buffet selection was great. Upgraded our package to include laundry, wifi, drinks and snacks. It was well worth the extra $75 per room per night. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We were given late check out 8PM with no extra change. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel in Singapore and used points to redeem a night. Singapore hotels have in recent years become hugely expensive and with breakfast for a family of 4, a stay here would be close to £200 a night inclusive of taxes etc. For a Holiday Inn that is expensive. Checking was thoroughly professional and my platinum status was acknowledged with an offer to upgrade to a suite however with just 1 bed. I turned down the offer and thanked them whereupon free Internet and free breakfast was offered. Then there was 4 free welcome drinks in the bar and an offer of late checkout. It was a great start! The room on the 8 th floor was as far from the elevator as you could get but the modern sleek and spotless room made up for the walk. The picture window looked out onto a building which was a shame but a park vew would be wonderful for the massive picture window. The bathrooms were modern and well equipped. The flat screen TV had useful and accessible access for iPod plugs etc and was easy to use. There was a dVD player also and a extensive mini bar and free tea and coffee. All in all a great room. We went to the bar for a free welcome drink to find that it offered a wide range of drinks including alcohol and cocktails. It was perhaps the best welcome ever at a hotel and included all 4 of us and not just the card holder or adults. I estimate that the drinks would have costs around £30. The service was superb from very welcoming and chatty staff. We checked out early and the hotel stored our bags for the day. Upon our return we were permitted access to the pool and showers where we freshen up before catching our long flight home. The location is great right on Orchard and next to a great range of eateries. It is howver expensive but then all Singapore hotels are. We are returning to sIngapore in August and will almost certainly stay here again. It is the best Holiday inn I have ever used.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: amykate255
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the Easter long weekend and there was nothing I could fault the hotel on. I arrived early in the morning and the staff were very friendly and held our bags fo us as we were unable to check in at the time. After checking in our bags were taken to our room straight away. We got upgrade to the executive floor and got breakfast included daily. The breakfast was amazing and the executive lounge staff were outstanding. Rooms were spacious, modern and very clean. The location of the hotel was amazing just 2 mins walk to orchard road and about 5 min to the nearest train station. Would definatly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience and best for people looking for halal/cheap food nearby”
Reviews.Author: awsom316
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the recommendation of my uncle as he summarized the hotel as best for location along with the beautiful i interior etc etc, and he was very much right about it! The hotel is at one of the best locations one can possibly be at in Singapore. There is almost everything at a walking distance from the hotel and the best thing is that there are a lot of local food restaurants where you can taste the local food and that at a very reasonable price. Even though there is no issue of halal food in Singapore but still at times i wanted to eat something cheap and something different from K.f.c, Mcdonalds and Burger king(these 3 are halal everywhere in Singapore and available almost every 4 kilometers) and the local restaurants were right in front of the hotel. The added advantage is that you are right in front of one of the best shopping centre's and then you are 2 minutes away from Mrt. The staff is excellent,humble and very helpful. They were very courteous and the best thing was that everyone was smiling always and that surely makes one feel good no matter how bad you are feeling. It was not only me but my kids as well who enjoyed the stay and i never felt that i was alone to take care of the kids. Whenever i got a bit busy with the concierge or the reception,someone from the hotel staff was already there to take care of my children so i would say that it was amazing to feel like home away from home. The breakfast was amazing specially the fresh juices they served and the helpful attendants. One of the best things about the breakfast was that they had different set of dining for the kids and in different colours as well. Overall i would rate the hotel 9/10 except for the 'internet'! It wasn't free in the first place and even the charges were too high for a country like Singapore and apart from that i feel that internet should be free as per compliments from the hotel because you are staying at a 4star+ property! Would definitely recommend it for families as well as individuals and Muslims.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: UKJohn88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a stopover back to London. Nice hotel to stay. Room was a reasonable size. Stayed in an executive room so had access to the lounge. Nice canapes and drinks in the evenings. Also had a complimentary cocktail in the lounge. Breakfast in the restaurant had a good variety of Asian and Western. Had a buffet lunch there too on the day of arrival which was excellent. Nice selection of food. Location is excellent. Just a few minutes walk to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Recognizes PC Platinum Status”
Reviews.Author: mattfs218
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel thru a priceline bid and was extremely happy with the service and price, considering Singapore is rather expensive now. They could not upgrade my room, so they gave me, my wife, and my son free breakfast for 3 days. The room was good. Only downsize is internet cost money, but that is what 3g is for! Location is PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: omidi_farhad
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is at orchard road (shopping area), 5m to subway. Clean & huge room. With help full staff

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel with excellent breakfast near Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: KEGillesen
Reviews.Content: We found very good rates for Holiday Inn Orchard City Centre in different hotel sites, and discovered it was rated as one of the best in the city. We were also very happy with our stay here from March 31st - April 3rd. The door men and concierges welcomed us, and gave us a free drink in the lobby bar because our room was not ready yet. When #303 was ready, our bags were quickly brought to our room by the staff. We ordered a room with two double beds, because we travel with our children aged 5 and 3 and have a lot of bags. The room was spaceous, nice and clean. Water bottles were complimentary, and there also was a CD player in the room. Bathroom with tub was also large and convenient for the four of us. Breakfast was very good with a lot of food for us who prefer western. Many kinds of bread, varieties of coffee, fresh fruit and juices made us happy. So did the smiling and nice staff here. In the lobby there is also a small gift shop, and at the roof top a gym, two pools and lots of space to enjoy the sun. Hotel location is great, just 2 minutes walk from Orchard Road. Because of late onward flight, we could keep our room until 2pm free of charge. All in all: We could not want more from our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dated but Ilike it !”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a very friendly city and the hotel is no different. From the outside, it is a fairly low rise hotel, a little non descript. I think it has a total of 4 storey's. The location is excellent, just off Orchard Road. Within a 5 minute walk, you are amongst an abundance of food choices - Singapore is certainly a culinary delight. Shopping Malls are located along Orchard Road. I noticed a Starbucks within a 5 minute walk and various bars. March is a pleasant time to visit - weaher wise, so enjoyed strolling around the area. Check in was swift and friendly. It was a business trip but despite this, could not fault the location at all, without a doubt, it would suit business and leisure travelers alike. I am a smoker and usually, not given the best rooms in a hotel - nor floor. I had the business lounge as part of my room rate, including wi fi and wired internet. Both worked fine. The room appeared a little dated, I had 2 double beds, which was fine. Sleep quality was good, ample pillows and all together, the room was a decent size. The bathroom was equally dated. Shower was in the tub and whilst there were 2 shower heads, the pressure was not fantastic. Closet space was ok for the short trip. I had noisy neighbours and since there was an inter-connecting door, put the volume down to that. I am a heavy sleeper, so it did not bother me too much. Certainly no street noise. I took breakfast in the main area one morning. Staff were friendly and there was a fairly decent spread, but the dining area was cramped and dated. They need to get rid of the carpet and spruce the place up. The remainder of my mornings and whe I arrived back at the hotel in the evenings, would go to the club lounge. The club lounge lacks reading materials and is not particularly big. However, both breakfast and evenings cocktails/snacks are fine. Overall, I found the staff make this place, in particular those in the club lounge - whom I interracted the most with. The location is perfect. I would rate this a full thumbs up but for 2 things : Bedroom windows are filthy outside. Considering it's a low storey buildining, really no excuse. The bedrooms - at least the one I was in, needs refurbishing as does the main breakfast area. Other than those 2 points, thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: StanleyPune
Reviews.Content: We decided to book the Holiday Inn for our 7 days vacation of Singapore. With 2 children, it was more economical to book a large room with 2 double beds rather than 2 rooms, and the hotel gave us that option. The hotel is at quite a convenient location, with the Orchard Street Malls at a walking distance. Also close are the Cuppage plaza and Centrepoint where one can find all convenience stores and eating joints. The hotel itself has an Indian Restaurant. For travel purposes, one can get private buses from Concorde Hotel (just behind) to and from places like Jurong Bird Park, Zoo, Night Safari etc. They are at fixed timings and cheaper than cabs. The MRT station (Somerset) is also very close by to Holiday Inn. The breakfast in the hotel was quite varied with enough options for vegetarians like us. The hotel room was large, and equipped with everything we would need for a week stay. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. All the people, including the front desk, concierge, room cleaning staff were very polite and professional. We used the swimming pool and the jacuzzi on the terrace, and it was great fun especially on sunny days. Overall, must say that this Holiday Inn was one of the best one I stayed in, and would definitely recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Orchard road.”
Reviews.Author: WATravel65
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after the reviews on Tripadvisor. It is very close to orchard road and also to the MRT at Somerset. If you can its better to upgrade your room and also the use of the lounge in the afternoon for drinks and snacks. just make sure to ask for a room up on level 7 and room nos 730 upwards and not facing the freeway. The buffet breakfast in the hotel is outstanding with heaps of choices. They even have a little section for kids for breakfast, with own bowls,plates and spoons. Overall a good hotel to stay at when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: rdmo60
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel and great location. Rooms large for Asian hotels and this is by far the nicest Holiday property that I have stayed at. Easy walking distance to shopping mall and subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Sling”
Reviews.Author: Tabila
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at the Holiday Inn Orchard City Centre in late March. After arriving in Singapore late at night we checked in at the hotel and were ecstatic to be upgraded to a king bed suite on the executive club floor-what a great start to our visit and an advantage of being a Platinum Priority Club member. The hotel is well located close to busy Orchard Road where the miriad of shoppping centres can be found as well as a very efficient public bus and train service (MRT)-Somerset is the closest station. The hotel appears to have been refurbished in the last few years with an attractive lobby and bar area which was nice to relax in.The king bed suite was tastefully decorated with two bathrooms and a separate lounge room including modern flat screen TV. The bedroom was spacious with a flat screen TV, comfortable bed and good quality linen and pillows. Both bathrooms were of a good size and well appointed with an array of toiletries. The exceutive lounge was almost opposite the room and a fantastic place to have breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks. The General Manager, Kanchan Kanwar has taught her staff well and the executive lounge team of Sheena, Darren and Mia provided a high level of attentive service for our entire stay which was much appreciated. I would have no hesitation returning to this hotel in the future and recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Celinell
Reviews.Content: Everything found was nice and close to perfectness. Concierge was extremely helpful and friendly, reception was efficient and the whole setting was fabulous! Rooms were a touch to perfectness as everything was found to be clean and faultless. Huge bathroom in a preciously small city centre was another addition to it. Huge screen TV was also offered with a vast selection of channels. Beds offered were huge. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and pretty good rooms”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLiew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HI for 4 nights back in Feb 2011 (not Apr 2011 as this review is very overdue) for business trip. Love that it's near to Orchard but yet you won't get disturbed by the noise from the street as it's a few small alleys away. Very convenient as the MRT is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bconwayOU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HI Orchard City Centre for 3 nights. It is nice property in a really excellent location with lots of places to eat and drink right out the door. Also a short walk from Orchard St and the Sommerset metro stop. The HI has decent food options also. Wireless internet was fast and could be found throughout the hotel. If you do stay here be sure and get a room that is not on the highway (front) side of the hotel. The "gym" is *extremely* small and options within walking distance of the hotel - Fitness First, CA Fitness, etc are really expensive on a drop in rate. If a hotel gym is important to you, dont' stay at this HI.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staffs and good location”
Reviews.Author: Jessee2000
Reviews.Content: Good location.walking distance to Somerset MRT,Plaza Singapore,Centrepoint Mall,313 Shopping Centre,Orchard Centre, Nearby have 24 hours 7-11,pubs... very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shay666
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights. Singapore itself is not a very inspiring place but the hotel itself was very good. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qonrad G
Reviews.Content: Always stay there. Good location right near the shopping areas of Orchard road! It's great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Holiday Inn, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Vecchio59
Reviews.Content: Location: excellent, just 200 yds from Orchard Rd Service: great, warm as usual in Singapore. Unfortunately, access to the VIP LOunge is not free, even if you are a Platinum card... surprising. Room: I was given a free upgrade to Junior Suite, good size also for Americans Window on the Park Restaurant: basic for dinner (also buffet), good enough fro breakfast (buffet only) Tandoori Restaurant: recommended, nice price and good quality. My choice was curry chicken and basmati rice.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: yearbook1
Reviews.Content: I don't see how anyone could find fault with this hotel. Service was excellent. The rooms are modern and very clean and attractive. Friendly faces everywhere. Buffet breakfast had an excellent variety of food. Loved the fresh squeezed orange juice! International buffet very good. There was a huge number of unexpected benefits in the executive lounge which we were given as platinum members. Centrally located. Easy to get cabs. Fast internet. A block away from tons of shopping and restaurants. What else can you want from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandra16
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a return flight from Europe. Accommodation in Singapore is expensive however I stayed on the exeucitve floors with access to the executive lounge and I thought that this was good value. And I wasn't on a business trip so don't let this put you off stayting here. The location of this hotel is ideal - almost in the middle of the Orchard Road strip but set a little back so it is quiet with very little pedestrian traffic. Easy access to shops and restaurants. And if you like to walk around a city to get the feel of it, it's a 15 minute walk to Little India and Arab Street. Chinatown is a little further but still a good walk. The other standout at this hotel was the level of service from staff. Fantastic - friendly, courteous and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble,including suggestions for particiular shopping centres/malls! The room itself was extremely comfortable and spacious. No outside noise at all. I would definitely stay here again on another trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: jc w
Reviews.Content: Hotel in itself is a buisness hotel , far from most shopping sights , I liked the smoking rooms as there are no balcony

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pradeep_Basu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 days and must say service was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugCaliGirl
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located in a nice location, very close to Orchard street. Great shopping, tons of food choices and nice areas to walk around. While the room I was in faced the freeway/large road, I did not hear a thing in the room. The room itself was quite comfortable and clean, with all the modern equipment one could want. Breakfast was good, a resonable choice of items, but coffee seemed to take an extremly long time to get. Maybe larger coffee cups or a self-serve option would keep us coffee lovers happier.

Reviews.Title: “Location very good as was the service”
Reviews.Author: bachus_10
Reviews.Content: Computer system was under a viral attack when we were checking in but as we were staying on the Executive level we were able to wait in the lounge until the front desk found an available room. Rooms comfortable and of the standard expected. Good choice of restaurants right outside the hotel. Nice if small rooftop pool. The Executive lounge was excellent, good selection of wines, beers etc and the range of snacks was diverse and tasty! The standard of breakfast was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Tripitip
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Location is perfect for us, just one street away from Orchard Road with plenty of food vendors and some supermarkets. Room is modern, clean and spacious with big screen TV. Bathroom is bright and clean, with shampoo, soap, body lotion, shower cap, hair band, etc... You name it! Generally service was friendly, nice little attentions included like little chocolates from the room service. When we ordered food, this came very fast and was tasty. We are one family with 1 young kid and the twin room with 2 queen size beds worked well for us. Pool was big enough, there is a separate pool for kiddies as well. The only thing that stop us giving 5 points is only the fact that you need to pay extra for internet (about 25 SGD for 24 hours for medium speed, and more for faster connection). Note: If you come back to the hotel with taxi, the easiest direction is 'Holiday Inn behind the Centerpoint' (shopping mall). A taxi driver took me to a wrong building which was about 6 minutes away saying that that used to be Holiday Inn. It could be just him but name the mall, it won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: ImranJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nicely decorated. It was equipped with modern amenities such as a large LCD TV and also a DVD player. It also provided more audio visual inputs in case you brought your own PS3 or Xbox. We could also choose from a variety of special pillows on top of what was provided in the room. I asked for the magnetic pillow and had a pleasant and refreshing sleep. The staff were polite and very helpful. The check in process was smooth and very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: WaikatoChick29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to MRT station & bus stops. Service was great, the room was spacious and comfortable and the hotel was very modern and clean. We upgraded to an executive room and it was well worth the extra. Breakfast was included, great variety and quality of food. We also had the use of the executive club lounge, where we enjoyed free snacks and soft drinks, as well as canapes and alcoholic drinks every evening. Overall, this would have to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. I have already recommended it to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: jbgt
Reviews.Content: Good location (just behind Centrepoint, Orchard Road). Close proximity to shopping centres, pubs, restaurants, MRT, banks,etc. Comfortable room/bed and nice bathroom amenities. Friendly cafe staff (breakfast) but front office staff can do better (Not so friendly and too mechanical. They seem to just want to quickly check you in and check you out like a factory line). A nice hotel to stay with minimum of fuss unless you want more attention, then head for the Raffles.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Alcabideche
Reviews.Content: My husband & I choose this hotel for our honeymoon after reading the reviews on trip adviser and we were dissapointed. The staff in the lobby on arrival were friendly and efficient making for a smooth check in process. Our room was beautiful- spacious, great facilities and clean. The location itself was perfect and short walk to the main shopping strip or the underground system. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for great rating in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Margaret C
Reviews.Content: Several of us were traveling in Singapore and I picked this hotel which was a few $s more, but one rating higher. I definitely made the right choice. It felt (smell and look) like a 4 star hotel but not priced as one. My other colleages hotel smelled and looked like a much lower rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location. Cheaper price if book at desk at Singapore airport”
Reviews.Author: Desigal7
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights but our flight in was changed by the airline to an earlier flight and we arrived at 1 a.m. The hotel desk at the airport got us a room for 1/3 of the price we got on the internet. It might be risky but I wish I had just gotten to the airport and booked the 4 nights from there. Great location at end of Orchard Street shopping strip. Many walkable sites to see. Live entertainment in lobby and bar most nights. Pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “It's fabulous :)”
Reviews.Author: RetnoNiekno
Reviews.Content: Nice location at Orchard road. Clean room n friendly staff. A warm place away frim home.

Reviews.Title: “A bustling city hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: S28
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a week whilst on the way back from a family wedding. The location of the hotel was excellent, close to fantastic restaurants and food courts, as well as shops! My son had a blast in the rooftop pool. Easy access to the MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: h4r10
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on my previous experiences in staying in some Holiday Inn Express hotels in UK and China, I always love their comfortable beds. But in this hotels, it was even better. The twin beds that I booked was considerably large to accomodate 2 adults (I am average Asian size). The room was spacious and luxuriously decorated. It was worth the money (considering that accomodation in Singapore is generally expensive). Check-in and check-out was easy and fast. They even granted my request to have late check-out until 4 pm. Breakfast came with various food and taste delicious. This is the first hotel in Singapore that I stayed in that provides "non-halal" sign for the dishes that they served for breakfast. They even provide "qiblat" direction sign in the room for moslems. Very helpful for me to do my prayers. Short walking distance from Orchard road and Somerset MRT Station and about 15 minutes walk to Dhoby Ghout Interchange MRT Station. Will be back someday. Keep up the good work, staffs!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AReview80
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Upgraded to make use of executive lounge with wine, nibbles, afternoon tea etc. Concierge and all staff very helpful. Kids made good use of swimming pool. Would definitely stay there next time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Lunar New Year”
Reviews.Author: Ariel650
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this and you've already booked the H'Inn Orchard, don’t worry, it is as all hotels in this class should be, clean, comfortable, well-appointed and we found the friendly staff excellent, especially in the Garden View restaurant. The hotel is right next to a 6 lane highway, which does spoil the 'garden view' a bit, but noise was not a problem for us. The pool is enclosed by high walls with not much plant cover, and the steps out of the pool are dangerous. If you have kids, this is not a resort hotel, and there will not be much to do locally unless they enjoy shopping. Orchard Road is the main attraction for this hotel. The shop house restaurants on Cuppage, right outside the hotel back door mean you don’t even have to walk the 2 minutes to Orchard Road itself without being spoiled for great food choice of everything you can think of. An Irish style pub there too. Breakfast in the hotel is excellent with typical buffet, very generous and well served, so much so we found queues outside the restaurant each morning, but since the previously mentioned staff could clear, clean and reset a table in less than 1 minute, not so much of a problem. My wife and I visited on a short break from elsewhere in Asia and I know perhaps because it was Chinese New Year our experience may not have been typical. Nevertheless, gets a 4 from us, only spoiled by the pool walls and steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mikkel G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days while we were in Singapore. It was great, we were there at Christmas time so it was very busy, a little expensive though. Its right near Orchard Rd, where everything is. Also, a huge food court right behind the hotel. Nice hotel, clean rooms, good pool and fitness room. Very friendly helpful staff, I requested a screwdriver for a remote and an engineer was there within minutes. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore,Singapura”
Reviews.Author: Foxysardar
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel and they have an excellent lobby! Checking was not great as our room was not ready however they compensated us by offering us drinks and the bar. The drinks were just fabulous. Room is very spacious and has LCD and iPod player so we really had a great time also guest get complimentary parking. I would love to stay here again.Good hotel and with good staff~

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND A VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CAPTRON83
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel everytime we come to Singapore and are never disappointed. Our stay this time was great because the rates for the Exe Floor rooms were excellent and you get free breakfast, free internet and free drinks in the evening if you use all these "perks" your room will end up costing you about $100 a night. All the rooms are large, quiet and comfortable, you won't be disappointed, we have been coming here for 10 years 3 times a year. This hotel is located right next door to an outdoor food court that has at least 12 different place to eat and drink, if you can't find something you like to eat here I'm not sure if you ever will....

Reviews.Title: “Good location for easy access to Orchard's shopping spree...”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictjkt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one short-stay night last end-year en route to Hanoi. Everything is standard of a Holiday Inn. Location wise is excellent for easy access to Orchard, only 1-2 minutes walking. Our package didn't include breakfast, so cannot comment on it. However, surrounding the hotel there's plenty of food options (price wise, taste wise, etc). Cuppage Plaza's just accross the hotel, there's a small food establishment there that sells 'wonton (fried & steam)' which's so delicious (if I'm not mistaken, it's a Malaysian chain). The place also sells a variety of local desserts which're all very tasty. So, don't miss it while you stay there. Only one downward's that the non-smoking room was not available, eventhough we have specifically requested it thru' an advance on line booking.

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing break.”
Reviews.Author: Helen97
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. On arrival we were greeted by the assistant manager Eugene who personally took us to the room and explained everything. He was charming as were all the staff we encountered. Club rooms are of a high standard and the food in the lounge, from breakfast to evening "snacks"/ wine/beers were excellent . Once again the staff were so helpful, especially Ivy who was always interested in our days forth coming activities. The pool area on the roof is lovely, especially at 6.30 am with the swallows bobbing around the water. I was usually the only person there, although the gym always seemed busy. On our last day our plane back to the UK was not until 11.30pm. After the 4pm check- out we stayed around the pool and were asked to enjoyed the complimentary cocktails in the lounge before leaving for the airport, a really nice touch I thought. Favourite things to do, Botanical gardens/ National orchid Gardens allow at least half a day. The Zoo and Bikit Tamah nature reserve, probably a day each. Hire bikes on the island of Pulau Ubin and see the amazing array of wild life and drink fresh coconut juice Try a new Hawker food- centre each evening for some interesting food and people watching...Buy silk fabrics at Mahaco 51 Arab St, where you will find a very large array of silk dupion in hundreds of colours. An excellent break, but you have got to love the heat , We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location for a family visit”
Reviews.Author: Barry L
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family in adjoining rooms for four nights. We would recommend this hotel highly for a short stay in Singapore. Rooms were spacious, in very good condition and well equipped. Restaurant breakfast buffet was very good. Avoid the restaurant for other meals as very pricey given the abundant options nearby. The rooftop pool is great, very private and large, great for relaxing after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth trip here”
Reviews.Author: Redjazz68
Reviews.Content: Again, very good hotel. Chose a club room and used the excellent lounge facilities. Tried to breakfast in the main restaurant one morning and went back to the club lounge as the breakfast was far superior in quality. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and lounge staff”
Reviews.Author: Fran B
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed here twice in the past year and both times have found the staff excellent, especially in the Business Lounge. There is also a good selection of items for breakfast as well as the 'nibbles' at night time. The hotel is quite 'plush' when compared to the Holiday Inns found back in the UK. The central location is also excellent, being near to the main shopping areas, bus routes and underground terminals. There are also a number of restaurants and fast food outlets nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: irenet9
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a stop over to Australia for 4 day's, what a beautiful hotel, the staff could not do enough and the Hotel had some great deals if you ask at the desk. The rooftop pool was a bonus and kept spotlessly clean with someone alway's on hand. The location was great right in the middle of shopping etc. Also the hotel had some excellent restaurants to suit every pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark130567
Reviews.Content: Just had a couple of days here on way back from Vietnam. Hotels in Singapore are expensive and this had a good deal if you paid when you booked. Front Office was excellent at check in and the staff were great throughout the two days (especially Eugene and Ivy) - great sized rooms (with all amenities that you would expect) - location is second to none despite first impressions when you arrive - driving in off of an extremely busy road. I agree with some comments about the WIFI being expensive however if you upgrade to Executive Floor at check in WIFI is free as is great buffet breakfast, afternoon tea (2-4pm) , cocktails and finger food (lots of it) (6-8pm) and a myriad of other benefits - there are also lots of coffee shops nearbyu with free WIFI. Whilst my favourite business hotel in SIngapore is still The Fullerton this is good value for money when travelling with your family - it is certainly the best Holiday Inn that I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Older property but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: tmolta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a block or so off of Orchard Road at the beginning of the shopping portion of it. You can turn right and head into the shopping portion or turn left and head to the museums, Little India, Chinatown, etc. We liked that flexibility. (Of course, you can also take the subway pretty much everywhere bu tthen you miss out on the street sights along the way.) The hotel is very comfortable with a few luxe touches, i.e., you won't mistake it for a Holiday Inn in the U.S. We were treated very well and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good,but some improvements necessary”
Reviews.Author: hdgleich
Reviews.Content: We stood here from 10th to 16th of January 2012.Although be booked a Junior Suite SMOKING and got a confirmation for this room,we got a non-smoking room for the first day,so we had to move on the 2nd day.Not so comfortable.But the room was quite nice and spacy. Had park view.Service all over all very busy and satisfying.Can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorable stay at the center of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: snowglobe1706
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre last Dec. for the first time. I've been inside this hotel before but haven't stayed. During my stay, I had a good accommodation. When I first entered the lobby, they have a very welcoming aura. However, I should've stayed in the room that is facing the Orchard road. So that would be my advice for those who are planning to stay in this hotel. It seems that the hotel is fully booked during my stay so I was assigned to a room facing the highway. I missed the sight of the wonderful Christmas lights along the Orchard road from the hotel. I cannot complain about the location of the hotel. It's not along the busy road of Orchard, but it is very reachable as it is just at the Somerset Area. It's very close to other restaurants, malls, and to the mrt station. My tip is that it's also close to other massage centres. When I entered my room, it has a good spacious feeling. Compliment fruits are already on the table. A safe is provided. There's a working desk with phone. A phone can also be found on the bedside table and in the bathroom. A large-screen flat TV (although not enough channels) is hooked on the wall opposite the bed. A DVD player and and iPod dock is also provided. There are also hub for connecting your PC/laptop to the TV, if you have the proper cables. They also have universal socket, so don't worry if you're coming from Europe and forgot your universal adapter. Internet is provided in every room, although you have to assess which package of internet connection is practical. It depends on one's duration of stay. The bathroom has very good lighting and clean. There's no separate shower cabin, so the shower is also at the tub with a separate glass. They have fog-free mirrors, clean towels daily, and toiletries. Importantly, the bed mattress is very comfortable. 2 types of pillows are provided - firm and soft. Although you can order special pillows - hypo-allergenic, memory foam, body to lie on, and magnetic therapy. Thus, they really make sure that when you take a rest in their hotel, you really feel rested :). This hotel has also good facilities (pool, 1 restaurants for non-members, gym, sauna, bar, computer station). The concierge are friendly although they could've been more updated with what's happening around Singapore since they weren't aware of the electronic sale going on at the Expo when I asked about it. Room service is prompt. The menu, however, doesn't have a long list of dishes to choose from. So better to eat at the restaurant. They have an open bar, just beside the check-in counter and with entertainment when the sun dawns. My accommodation is inclusive of breakfast so I had a good taste of the choices of dishes they provided for their guests. Their breakfast has a wide range of dishes - Japanese, Chinese, Malay, Indian and continental. You can order on demand for which type of coffee or tea you want. That also goes for freshly extracted fruit juice and egg. Since the hotel is quite full during my stay, the refill of dishes at the buffet table was not as quick as I would've wished it to be. And this happened not only once but for several times. Servers are friendly, although they tend to be friendlier and more attentive to non-Asian guests. All in all, I had a favorable stay at Holiday Inn Ochard Centre during my 2-week business trip.

Reviews.Title: “First rate service and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Marie3233
Reviews.Content: Searched high and low for a hotel that offered a suite with separate lounge and bedroom areas for less than SD$1,000. We were in transit through Singapore for a night with our 1 year old son and desperately wanted to be able to relax after we had put him to bed. The Holiday Inn Orchard City, whom I phoned direct, were helpful immediately and also very economical for Singapore at <SD$500 (exc taxes) for a suite on the Executive Level. They also allowed us a complimentary extended check out to 6pm (standard on Exec Level is 4pm). Hotel is gleaming and like no Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at before, all the staff we encountered were very helpful. We were provided a cot and baby toiletries at no extra charge, plus the breakfast restaurant has childrens plastic bowls/plates cutlery etc.. as well as the obligatory high chair, we were also offered toys to keep our son amused. Location is also brilliant, near to all the high end shops of Orchard Rd but also located behind a great alley full of authentic little local restaurants. My only comment would be that lower levels (we were on 6th of 8th floors) may be a little noisy due to the main road running behind the hotel. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not much has Changed, still an excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: YG1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre for the second time and was not disappointed. The hotel retains all its' virtues and had the pleasure of staying at the club floor and access the lounge which was very nice. The only small criticism I have is regarding the Gym, which is tiny (five man could barely squeeze and practice at the same time)- they might consider expanding that to accommodate more people. Will definitely come back in the future as the price, quality of service and location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRosenthals
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many excellent hotels, and this as good as any we have ever stayed. The entire hotel is immaculate. Room was modern and superbly maintained. Staff is courteous and professional. If at possible, get access to the Executive Lounge. We went to the lounge for snacks and drinks, and found the food to be so delicious and plentiful that we cancelled our plans for dinner. Breakfast buffet in the lounge was over the top. We will definitely stay here anytime that we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An 'upscale' Holiday Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KFSKSP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely more upscale (almost a 5-Star hotel standard) than a typical Holiday Inn, partly thanks to a recent major refurbishment. Located in a relatively quiet area just off Orchard Road which is perfect. Nearest MRT station is Somerset. The only access road is via Orchard Road, so beware of traffic congestion in the area. Breakfast is so-so quality with limited variety. There are a wide variety of restaurants nearby at the Cuppage and other shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Vivek K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the holiday inn orchard for 3 nights in jan 2012. Location is just off the orchard road, has big comfortable rooms, nice breakfast and very nice staff. Shopping malls and a plethora of restaurants are at a stones throw distance. The price is also reasonable. I will certainly stay at the hotel again. The only minus is that there is no free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful break”
Reviews.Author: JoFos
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 17 year old spent 3 nights staying in 1room. The room was large enough to accommodate our needs without feeling cramped. the breakfast fare was varied and thebusiness centre staff of great assistance. The hotel is very central but quiet as it was away from the main road. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: FCtravler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with large rooms, good service and located in a great spot near Orchard Rd. Expensive but isn't everything in Singapore. The bar area is nice with entertainment and the staff is overall helpful. Sadly for the price you pay it doesn't include internet which on it's own is very costly (a big negative). Didn't try the restaurants as there were too many other options outside. The guest services was very very helpful in making dinner reservations and getting us Maxi cabs when needed. The business center needs some help though, unprofessional staff who looked very confused. In order to support business needs they need staff here who can react much quicker and know how to use the computers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SBMJ222
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, friendly staff and a great location. There are many restaurants close by so you have lots of choice on where and what to eat. There is also lots to see and do close by so everything you could possibly need is within walking distance. There were also plenty of taxis available close by if you did need to travel anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Khalilaleker
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Easy location to anywhere - although Singapore is small. Customer service is good. Real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel conveniently located near the Orchard shopping precinct.”
Reviews.Author: Pongee
Reviews.Content: Rooms and hotel overall very well appointed, tasteful and luxurious. Good and courteous service. It's really good to be staying in an Asian hotel after all those decidedly average Aussie ones. Recommended, especially if you wish to be near Orchard Road. Register for the Priority Club when you make your booking for extra benefits like free breakfast, wifi and laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Super service at a budget price.”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is, in my experience, exceptional of its brand. I know that the Intercontinental Hotel Group has invested heavily in improving its mid-range brand and in this case, it has certainly paid off. The Holiday Inn, Orchard City Centre, formally The Parkview, is a relatively small hotel with 319 Rooms, now dubbed ‘boutique’ by its owners; it is an outstanding example of re-branding success. I have stayed in most of the high end hotels in Singapore, including the latest addition, the Marina Bay Sands and this one compares favourably with its big brothers. The rooms have undergone a total refurbishment, which has brought them well up to 5 star standard, in all but size. They all boast high speed internet access, a proliferation of electric points, an iPhone/iPod dock, plenty of TV channels, excellent lighting and a pillow menu, everything one would expect from a hotel charging considerably more. What makes this Holiday Inn exceptional however, are not the refurbished rooms and facilities but the staff, staff training in this hotel is of the highest standard, all are efficient, charming and helpful beyond the call of duty. The technical services were also remarkable; we had a computer hiccup whilst staying at the hotel and they made their technical manager available to us and he was a great help, he fixed everything, explained the problem and gave us a lesson on how to cope with the vagaries of net access in Asia. The club lounge is one of the best I have used, breakfast is superb, very good canapés and snacks are provided during happy hour and the service is incomparable. The restaurant on floor B1 which describes itself as ‘North Indian’ is one of the best Indian restaurants I know and I being a fan of a good curry, I have eaten in many, all over the world. Don’t bother fighting for taxis in Little India, eat here and be delighted by the service, atmosphere and cuisine. I can heartily recommend the seafood set menu, which boasts a starter of spicy crab meat, lobster and prawn, excellent! I can only suggest that, if you normally use the higher end IHG hotels in Singapore, Intercontinental or Crowne Plaza, then you should give this mid-range budget gem a try, you may just be as surprised as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanelrm0
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early at the hotel and although booking in wasn't until the afternoon, they asked us to wait about 1/2 hour while they prepared our room for us. That was wonderful as we managed to then grab a couple of hours sleep before heading off to explore. The ambience of the hotel was lovely and the rooms were more than adequate, very tastefully decorated too. The location was perfect for access to Orchard Road shopping and also easy to get to other places either by walking or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAC-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed in this hotel; the last time was 10 years ago. I chose this hotel because of the location--sort of at the end of the main shopping strip on Orchard Road. In addition to Orchard Road being about 1.5 blocks away, the hotel offers easy access to public transit (buses and MRT). But in the 10 years since I last visited, the hotel has been remodeled and has definitely gone upscale. The rooms were clean, modern, and spacious. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom is amazing. The refrigerator in the minibar has room for food if you want to buy some. The internet service is fast but, like most hotels outside of North America, it's an additional, pricey fee. That's probably my only gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family & convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: psiew13
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a family hotel with 2 double bedded in the room (can fit 4 pax), this is the hotel you want to stay. Most Singapore hotels are small, tiny and twin bedded room comes with 2 single beds only. The price we paid is definitely cheaper than booking 2 connecting rooms in other hotel. We booked directly with Holiday Inn website and got the executive package which includes 1 twin bedded room at club floor (level 3), full day access to club lounge for breakfast, afternoon snack & dinner, 2 pieces of pressed clothing, free drink voucher, late check-out at 2pm & free wifi in the room. Free car park offered for hotel guest but a little difficult to find the hotel at first. Hotel is within 5-10 mins walking distance to Somerset station (red line subway) and there are lots of eatery & shopping area just steps behind the hotel. LIKE: Spacious & clean room, twin bed (2 double beds), great for family, quick check-in, convenient location, club access with good spread & warm water jacuzzi at hotel roof top. DISLIKE: Crowded at club lounge during meals time This is really a good hotel for family.

Reviews.Title: “Executive room & lounge elevate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul_and_family
Reviews.Content: My family & I (2 adults & 2 kids aged 10 & 7) are return guests to this hotel and we would not book anything else apart from their executive package. For this, you get access to their executive lounge all day for drinks & snacks (A very social relaxed atmosphere in the evenings with Australian, British and French guests mingling, attended to by very friendly staff). Also included in the executive package are free wifi, all local calls, 2 pieces of laundry dry-cleaned per day and use of their business facilities. There are 2 double beds in their twin rooms which fit our family much better than other Singaporean hotels, and they offer a late 4pm check-out for those late flights from Changi airport. The only note of caution I would add is that some taxi drivers may have trouble finding the hotel because Cavenagh road is a little discontinuous and there are a number of 1-way streets leading to the hotel which can create navigation errors if one were purely going on the address - we found it useful mentioning entering from Kramat Road, and heading towards the Starhub building.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in more ways than one - you caouldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Asian_traveler2011
Reviews.Content: Located right in the "centre of the Singapore city" with Business district to multiple shopping outlets (luxury as well as mediocre, if i may use the word) to fantastic choices for food (good restaurant to Starbucks to local foods) to superb service and comfortable room and also, offering the pleasure of aimlessly sitting near the window of a cafeteria and watching the world go by... If that is what you look for, then look no further... Holiday Inn Singapore located @ Cavenagh road (parallel to the buzzing Orchard road) is the place to opt for! Cuppage Terrace located at a stone's throw distance offers Italian to Lebanese to Thai to Indian food choices... and also, a bar/pub!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Prafulla_Mujumdar
Reviews.Content: Its probably because we visited Singapore right after visiting Bali that we could feel the coldness in the hospitality of Singapore. The Holiday Inn premier room we chose for our stay was about 10 times smaller than the private Villa we were staying at Bali and we felt really good about our stuffed daily itinerary in Singapore as we would not have to spend too much time in our small room. Although I understand it is not fair to compare a hotel room to a Villa, I simply couldn't resist it. I certainly wouldn't say Holiday Inn was value for money as we were paying almost same as we paid for our Villa in Bali. However the two plus points of the hotel are the location of hotel and availability of Indian food at the Tandoor restaurant in the hotel. The hotel is located just a block away from the main Orchard street which was beautifully decorated for Christmas and has all the malls lined up there. We spent our first evening on the Orchard street shopping through the all decorated malls instead of sitting in the room. All the other things at hotel just follow the 'Holiday Inn' standards. No place to complaint really. Room service was good. Food at restaurant was 'not bad' (not great either). To conclude Holiday Inn is a safe bait as compared to other hotels in Singapore. The location is a plus. However nothing exceptionally good either. Certainly not an ideal place for honeymooners or couples looking for a cozy and relaxing stay. Try Bali for that purpose... ;-)

Reviews.Title: “I have already booked my next stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler190511
Reviews.Content: Most has been said about this hotel, location is great, service good, executive rooms are very comfortable and nicely decorated. The drinks and food in the executive lounge are great with sushi, satay, dumplings, salad etc and the service is great. Not sure why they switch off the main lights at 8 PM after the happy hour ends even when there are still people there. The gym is small but equipped with good machines. The hotel is 2 min from Orchard road and has ample opportunities for eating and drinking out. I have already booked my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cachecacher
Reviews.Content: stayed for 10 days on business. very happy overall. this hotel is rated within top 20 in singapore by tripadvisors and probably deserves that ranking. decor-wise, it is very new and comfy. i gather the rooms were recently renovated. actually, there were a bit of noise during my stay (it didn't bother me cos i was mostly out for work during the day) and i believe they are still doing minor renovations to the hotel. rooms have very comfy beds, good large LCD tv, good AC (essential in singapore!) etc. its a little small but nothing unbearable. remember to pick the pillows you want (a standard choose your type of pillow thing that's now avail at holiday inn hotels). for me the firm pillows were almost firm enough. bathrooms are very clean and of decent size too. service is very good. you get greeted everywhere i.e. concierge, reception, housekeeping. my only complaint was having to ask repeatedly for foreign laguage newspapers. they should keep better track of who's reading what and just keep sending those. the buffet breakfast is fantastic. there is a wonderful egg chef who makes your personal omelette etc. there is the usual english spread with toast, cereal, bacon, beans, hashbrowns etc. lotsa fruits and salad, some local cuisines like chinese dim sum, fried noodles, malay and indian sometimes depending on day of the week. it is always packed esp towards the last hour of breakfast so get there early and avoid having to line up for food. the wait staff at the restaurant was alright -- they tried their best to serve everybody coffee but sometimes it gets too busy and they simply forget. there was even one incident when they got me a table only for me to return with food and saw that they mistakenly gave the table away to someone else! but overall, good breakfast experience. did i mention location, location location?!! this hotel is right smacked in mid town. close to all public transport modes. not that i took the bus. but the mrt station was a 10-min walk away. the malls closeby give great dining options. i never once had to have dinner in the hotel although i heard it was not bad. lotsa pubs and bars in the area too. weekend nights are crazy in this area. you would have trouble finding a table to dine/wine in some of the more popular spots. definitely one of my top choices in singapore. price is decent so if i ever need a long stay (more than a week) i would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a month’s stay at this hotel after working in Singapore, it is the best Holiday inn I’ve ever stayed at, the hotel is very clean from the reception area all the way to the roof top pool. The rooms are spotless and well equipped with everything you need on a daily basis in a hotel, I stayed with the executive package which gave me the benefit of using the lounge on the 3rd floor, not only is the food and drink very good but the staff are EXCELLENT, Lee Kee, Sheena, Rose, Ivy and Cherry couldn’t do enough for you, they more than made you feel welcome. I was away from my family and these young ladies made me part of their family that made things very easy. They are a credit to the hotel and Holiday inn!!! Even if the Christmas tree in the lounge was the worst tree ever ha ha ha!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff make it great, good location”
Reviews.Author: TCK33
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the Holiday Inn brand, this is as good as some 5 star hotels in Australia. While its older, the rooms have been refurbished and a double bed each for a twin is great, especially for a week long stay. The little things like bottled water, turn down, and multi power points for any plugs are really good. Great location for shopping. Pool is nice and staff are very helpful esp concierge. My only gripe is the cost for internet and i believe they are working to change this. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff - we WILL be back...”
Reviews.Author: Heygman
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 night stay in Singapore. Usually we stayed closer to the intersection of Orchard and Scotts Road, but decided to try another location this time, and as seasoned Singapore visitors, we are glad we made this decision. This Hotel is very comfortable and is in a great location as others have said. The staff were pleasant and helpful, from checking-in at reception to checking-out. The checking in was rather protracted - due to a booking error on our part with two rooms booked (and the wrong combination of double and king beds requested for our extended family), but we got there in the end. We requested close proximity of the rooms if possible, and the Hotel obliged with a set of rooms with an adjoining door - we couldn't have asked for better, especially with our 18 month old able to flutter between Nan's room and mum and dad. :-) We were in the std Premier Rooms. They are clean and well appointed. Nice LCD panel with external inputs all ready for you to plug your media device into and play through the panel. (PC VGA, S-Video and composite video inputs, and L/R audio inputs). Also a DVD player with USB input for DivX is in place ready to go as well. The bathroom is well sized with a nice bath/shower combination. Good sized mirror which never seemed to steam up to an "unuseable" extent when in the shower - I wish other hotels could review the ventilation in this bathroom and match it in theirs! We took the room and breakfast package, and in all honesty the buffet breakfast is fairly standard for Singapore in terms of choice (mixture of Asian and European hot and cold choices), but it ALWAYS seemed to be very fresh no matter what time you arrived to eat, even down to the freshly squeezed orange juice. Jerie and her team put on a nice spread every morning and it kept us going through the day. A little play area for the kids is in the corner of the restaurant and ALL the staff loved the kids that were there, our youngster being no exception. We had room service two nights during our stay - due to arrival back late from tours and we couldn't be bothered to wander into the neighbouring cafes and restaurants - of which there are plenty. Good choice of room service up to 11pm, and after this there is still a reasonable selection of hot and cold food if you have the munchies at some crazy hour. And again, the food arrived hot, and it was full of flavour and very, very fresh. Room service is not cheap, but then you are paying for the convenience. We have read a couple of reports of rudness of staff - we never experienced this, but perhaps after struggling to get our message across once or twice, we can understand that this may lead to an element of frustration between the various parties. I'm not going to suggest that other Trip Advisor contributors have not had a bad experience - only that we struggled a few times but got through it... without walking away feeling that anybody was being rude or impolite. We didn't get to the pool or other hotel facilities, but they appear to be standard, down to the mini-bars, coffee and tea making facilities and safes etc in each room. My only criticism is that for internet access, you have to include it in your booking at an additional S$25/day (or it will be included in your room rate if you are taking an Exec room package). It's not cheap and you'd be better looking at other unsecured WiFi hotspots in Singapore if you cannot purchase a data-pack from your local carrier before you visit Singapore (e.g. McDonalds cafes) . The locals almost have WiFi coverage everywhere and it is unsecured, but as I understand it, to be able to use it you have to have a valid and current SIngapore Carrier mobile number. This minor internet access issue aside, this is a wonderful Hotel in a great location, and we'll be forgoing our previous regular "Royal" Scotts Rd hotel from now on to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel, walking distance to Orchard Road.”
Reviews.Author: BDeMaert
Reviews.Content: The negative things to the place are: the front of the hotel is right next to one of the busiest roads into the city, so expect a lot of traffic. The back faces a stretch towards Orchard Road, it's packed with restaurants and some bars. However it's fully safe to walk towards Orchard Road itself any time of day. Besides that the hotel - in itself - only has positive things to offer. I stayed here November 2010 for roughly two weeks, while on business in Singapore, having booked an Executive Room. Reception at the hotel was very pleasant after some 20+ hours of airports and flying, check-in went rapid, got offered some tea and a bottle of water. Staff is friendly and helpful at all times. The Executive room itself was spacious, and free soft-drinks from the minibar (and daily refills), 2 pieces of free laundry daily, and enough channels on the TV in case you were to tired to do anything else. Comes with a spacious enough bathroom and all necessities. If you have access to the Lounge, use it. It's well worth it, with a wide selection of appetizers in the early evening. Breakfast is vast with a very large selection, and friendly restaurant staff. The pool on the top floor of the hotel is a treat, never too crowded. But the biggest bonus this place has to offer is their staff. Every single one of them is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn review”
Reviews.Author: malcolms81
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Holiday Inn was excellent. The service was very prompt. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Its also conveniently located. We dont have anything to complain

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattUKManchester
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, located in the heart of the Orchard Road shopping zone. Walking distance from the Somerset metro station, with the walk taking around 5 minutes. Hotel itself is excellent, with large modern rooms and supurb customer service. The swimming pool is located on the roof of the hotel and always seemed very quiet. Noise was a slight issue, but I suppose this is to be expected in any 24 hour city centre location. For anyone who wants to do some sightseeing, the "hop-on hop-off" tour buses pick-up and drop-off within a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Overall, an excellent stay and more than happy to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay on the Executive floor!!”
Reviews.Author: N1970
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Definitely would stay there again. The service received on the executive floor was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than the average Holiday Inn - well located”
Reviews.Author: JMFTravels
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay at this hotel whilst on business in Singapore. Not my normal choice, but all in all a good hotel and better than the average Holiday Inn. As you come to expect in Singapore, the staff are just excellent and helpful right across the board. This hotel would suit both families, tourists, business travellers as there are many facilities and it is located just off Orchard Road - a hustling bustling shopping district. The room service was excellent as was the Executive Lounge. It is a spacious hotel with swimming pool, nice bar area with early evening music. The rooms were spacious and well equipped - normal standards. I would prefer if the internet was free, but that's a gripe that I have with all hotels in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Family visit - offer free wifi to your guests!”
Reviews.Author: descon7
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a getaway in a location that is very easy to get around from. Very close to Orchard Road shops and easy walk to bars, restaurants and public transport. We stayed in a room with 2 double beds with 2 children who both enjoyed the hotel and the pool facilities. the hotel should look at free wifi in the rooms as an extra bonus for travelers as most people want access to email and internet searches when try travel. The paid internet packages offered were very, very expensive and not welcoming for travelers. If the hotel included free wifi - they would pick up repeat business after speaking to other guests. Overall, this was a good place to stay for a first visit to Singapore. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HMEX
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Holiday Inn Orchard City Center in early Nov 2011. I had completed the booking a few weeks in advance and was confirmed in a room with double beds. On checking in, I was informed that they had only a room with a king size bed available and that they would throw in an extra bed in the room without any extra charge. They also treated us to a dinner at the Indian restaurant onsite which was a nice gesture (great food by the way, if you happen to stay at the Holiday Inn, make sure you eat there). I found the room to be quite small and less impressive than the photo that the reservation staff had shared with me earlier when I made my booking. The carpet in the room was very damp and smelly because the A/C was dripping. We informed the maintenance team and they fixed the problem but the humidity in the room did not fully go away during our stay. That said and on the whole, it was an OK experience and I would consider staying there again given the good service offered by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in other downtown hotels in Singapore but Holiday Inn seems to have been the most recently renovated. The rooms are spacious and even the cabinet drawers have this slow automatic shut(it closes by itself). The only negative thing that I could say is that although its located in the city centre(Cavenagh Road) its a bit far from the busy area of Orchard Road. The nearest MRT is Somerset station which also needs a bit of walking.I have lived in SIngapore for 10 years but this is the only time I came to know about Holiday Inns location.

Reviews.Title: “Service definately needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi88_10
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive things about this hotel - its in a great location, very close to Orchard Road, the rooms are nice aside from the somewhat terrible backwash toilet smell and the reception area is lovely, the breakfast is great with a good selection.... however its let down by what I can only describe as inconsistent levels of customer service. The breakfast staff were great - all very friendly and helpful but don't think for one moment that it extends to the all other staff. The majority of which either forget to come back to you, have no idea at all and give different information whenever you call or don't really seem to care. We had a complete debacle with the internet. When we first arrived we were told it wasn't included in the room rate, then we were told it was included in a $48 ++ per day rate and then after all this (3 days later) we discover its actually free. My advice is - don't book this place at the pretty expensive rate it is without getting the complimentary wi fi. We have stayed all over the world and I was shocked that a hotel like this in the IT capital of the world charges $1 a minute for the internet in the business centre! I mean come on. While this hotel is nice, there were some major drawbacks that the hotel needs to be sorted out - the first of which should be customer service training!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable rooms, good conceirge...”
Reviews.Author: vijayshah
