The front desk team was genuinely friendly, fast, organized and very proactive- and they checked in on him regularly after I left out of their own concern. The spacious rooms were perfectly equipped for a room-bound guest: the TV, DVD player and Internet access kept him entertained and occupied, and the dreamy bed and accessible bathroom made sure he was kept comfortable and safe. The room staff kept the room spotless, and the clean shirts and extra pillows were very appreciated. His mobility was limited, but he still needed to take a break from being in the room, so having the Club lounge close-by was the biggest bonus. ...again- pls let me go on about the staff! I am so personally grateful for the care they took to assist him with the breakfast buffet and the evening cocktails. Top notch! While I cannot comment on the other facilities, I am sure they are up to scrutiny, and the reported construction was of absolutely no disturbance to us. The location, just off Orchard, is perfect . A <5min walk yielded all I could need to load him up with extras before I left- and do a bit of personal shopping. I realize that our category of tourism is rather niche, but I would not hesitate to recommend the Holiday Inn Parkview for any type of travel. We will certainly be back! (better circumstances next time)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Brilliant, made a possible nightmare easier.”
Reviews.Author: tdc229
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 2 young children stayed here en-route to Australia earlier this year. The day after our arrival, our youngest daughter (8 months) took ill which we put down to the heat and humidity. The night before we were flying out to Australia she took a turn for the worse, the doctor was called (they arrived within 10 mins) she was taken into hospital with Gastroentoritis. (she was admitted and in her room and on a drip within the hour). I called the hotel to explain we would need to extend our stay for another 2 nights at least. It was no problem at all, the staff bought us a card and pesents for the baby and never charged us for the extra 2 nightsor the late check out on our departure day. I hasten to add that my daughters illness was nothing to do with the hotel or the country! Absolutely fabulous, and the manageress came to our room prior to our departure to present us with a framed photograph that had been taken of our daughters (with our consent). Both myself and my husband felt completely humbled by the staff and their generosity and would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to everyone. In fact we are staying there again in December when we emigrate to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: AthenaTravelManiac
Reviews.Content: We spent there 6 nights during our business trip to Singapore. The hotel itself has a great location, 5 minutes walk from Orchard road. And backside of the hotel there are many good restaurants: Italian res, Japanese res in Cuppage area. There is also a convenient shop nearby: 7eleven & coldstorage (in Centrepoint). The hotel is upgrading the restaurant in the lobby area therefore the lobby looks ugly and small at this moment. But I believe when the restaurant finish the lobby will be much nicer. We understand that Holiday Inn is a moderate brand of IHG but the service is excelent. Some floors are now upgrading and causing some noises during day time but it makes no sense to us. We were out all days and busy with shopping :-). The new upgraded room looks great, comtemporary design with Ipod sound blaster, LCD TV. We managed to have a nice view from our room, park view (although i am not sure there is park out there or not - minisized park). But the vehicle's sound is quite tough. If you wanna nice view then the disadvantage is the noisy sound. But in the morning the room is awesome with sunshinning thru' room's window. There is one thing we also love this place is the swimming pool on 8th floor: the pool's depth is around 2m50. The pool is big and peaceful. There is a big zacuri with warm water. Must try: Buffet dinner in Swissotel Merchant Court, only around SGD 46++ with seafood, fresh durian... I think that is best in town with that rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: ShazzaPerth
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were offered an upgrade to the club level which we accepted, the rooms were large and well presented. The club lounge whilst a little small was great the food was good and wine excellent. This hotel is very well located and has great facilities. The pool area was a surprise it felt like you were in Tuscany! Some renovations still going on but we were not disturbed by them, all staff very friendly and helpful. This is one of the best Holiday Inns we have stayed at and will certainly be coming back when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: LewisFox
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently under going renovation and we were lucky enough to get a new Executive room. We found the executive room very comfortable and very well equipped with DVD player, flat screen TV and especially the i-pod docking station – which if anything was ideal just for recharging the battery ahead of the return flight home. This hotel is centrally located, you can access all the key places really easily. The pool area is a bit tired but perfectly usable. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the concierge team who tracked down our lost travel wallet – not to mention the honesty of the taxi driver – who returned I to the hotel having located it in the back of his car!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, We Recommend the Premier Room”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel_585
Reviews.Content: We loved our 4-night stay at Holiday Inn Parkview, Singapore. We stayed here from June 11-15. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from the Somerset MTR station making it very convenient even if we go home late with many shopping bags. It is near the Centrepoint Mall, Paragon, Takashimaya, etc. We weren't able to try the Indian Restaurant that was highly recommended since we were out of the hotel most of the time. We only tried the Buffet Breakfast and the Room Service which are just okay. I find it too expensive for what they can offer. We stayed in a Premier Room. All Premier Rooms are newly renovated and thus have a modern look. The king bed was very comfortable. Rooms including the bathrooms are very clean. They refill the toiletries everyday. We didn't have problems with the noise as it was contained on the 9-6pm construction hours and as a I have mentioned, we were not in the hotel most of the time so the noise didn't bother us. There was definitely no ongoing construction after work hours. See the pictures I posted to give you an idea on the Premier Room. The other rooms are being renovated now that is why some people say they are outdated. We will definitely stay in this hotel again on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this hotel: service and noise a problem.”
Reviews.Author: ElizaRose
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, we arrived early --- 6am --- with two small children and the front desk allowed us into our room straightaway at no extra charge. Staff were friendly and nice to our children. Swimming pool area was nice. On the down side --- renovation to the reception area included very loud drilling, shouting and banging all day long. As we were still on European time and wanted to sleep in the day, this was unbearable after a while. We could not be moved as all the quiet rooms were full. The children's channel on the TV was down, and while they said they would send someone to look at it, no-one came; the channel was not fixed during our stay. The room was not serviced in the three days we were there. On the second day I rang down and asked that someone come and remove the old cups and wet towels, and the lady on reception sighed heavily and had quite a bit of tone in response to a fairly reasonable request. I thought 10 singaporean dollars for a cup of hot chocolate was pretty excessive, as was 55 dollars for two lemonades, a glass of wine and a small beer. I thought internet access was bizarrely expensive, especially as so many cafes and bars have free wifi, and there were a couple of those next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great family of five holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perth5Aussies
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the convenient location of this special hotel. Delicious buffet breakfast and relaxing pool. Helpful staff, frequent taxis and close to restaurants and shopping centres. Able to accommodate 5 people in one room. Dark room for kids with jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT & COURTESIOUS SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: gurpalsachdeva
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel with my wife and 2 kids. The Renovation is going on and they are renovating the rooms. The new rooms which were ready looked great. Though we stayed in one of their old rooms, which was no less comfortable and very good. Location is very good as the famous Orchard Road is walking distance. Exceptional mention to the kind gestures of the staff which makes one more welcome and will definitely recommend others. A SPECIAL WORD OF THANKS TO Mr. KENNY, FRONT DESK.

Reviews.Title: “worth it”
Reviews.Author: paras108
Reviews.Content: got a free upgrade without asking for both my rooms as it was off peak. staff at reception very friendly. this property of holiday inn is better than the atrium holiday inn. plus you are walking distance to orchard rd. views are of presidential palace. some refurbishment is going on but not noisy. good value for money. lobby is quite grand compared to holiday inn standards. rooms are quite large

Reviews.Title: “4 to a room's allowed”
Reviews.Author: Miran_Ali
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel through the reviews on tripadvisor for a s'pore hotel that allows you to take one room with two small children. The refurbished rooms are very nice with flatscreen tv's etc. The breakfast buffet is pathetic and is served in this horrible brown 70's coffee shop. The service in the coffee shop is pretty poor too. The pool is average but the hot tub is none too clean. The steam room is one of those home models. But I'd stay here again, because everything else in s'pore is even more overpriced and at least I get to take only one room. Some reviews mention the noise from the refurbishment, just specify that you are given a room where the work has been done. That's what I did.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good, but not the best value for money”
Reviews.Author: McHam
Reviews.Content: Liked the room, location is good, lovely swimming pool which feels nice and secluded from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road. Not very good value though, i stayed on the 8th floor and had to put up with the noise of renovation work on the floor below, at times it was very loud. My request for a room rate discount was met with indifference. Internet was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRE OF CITY”
Reviews.Author: RSM2324
Reviews.Content: good location entre of city from airport you get a hotel drop bus for sgd 9 only per person mrt somersat is very near shopping area is good lovely hotel and having renovtaion will come up with good view indina cusine is best

Reviews.Title: “Good location..but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: PriyaGK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights...was under going renovation...the rooms...bathrooms were very worn out... But expected better from Holiday Inn. Not bad location wise, just off Orchard road, great shopping and restaurants around. Pick up points of many tours really close by. MRT was little walk though...maybe seemed more so since our 4 year old was with us!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Singapore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMST78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stopover with our young daughter on our return from Europe and were very impressed with the hotel. The service was exceptional, the hotel was beautiful and the location was ideal for exploring Orchard Rd. The hotel was undergoing renovations at the time (which didn't cause us any disruption). I believe our room was still to be renovated but it was spacious and clean and had a very comfortable and large bed. A great hotel and I would certainly look to stay here again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: fayley
Reviews.Content: The pool on the roof is lovely, with a second small round pool about chest deep for toddlers. The service from when you step out the taxi is excellent, everyone is professional and accommodating. The rooms seemed to be recently refurbished and the rooms on the executive floor are just beautiful and relaxing and luxurious in an understated way. The hotel seems to cater to a lot of professional people working in Singapore, but we never got the feeling that our children weren't welcome. We stayed here on a stop over to Malaysia, and cut our Malaysian holiday short so that we could return here. Accross the road is an inexpensive quick laundry service, and a variety of places to eat from cheap to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Price”
Reviews.Author: vaibhav81
Reviews.Content: The location is great on orchard road. A slight bylane walk to the hotel. The tandoor restaurant food is awesome. Shopping is fun nearby. Rooms were neat and clean no problems. Staff was freindly and courteus. Overall great value for money in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: june252000
Reviews.Content: WE LOVED THIS HOTEL! I was in Singapore as a part of a group attending a conference in Singapore. Honestly, I was not looking forward to staying at a 'Holiday Inn' as it's not a hotel chain I would normally use. However, the location and price was perfect for our needs. I could write a ton about this hotel, but in summary:- - Check in was very smooth, even for a group - Newly renovated rooms were WONDERFUL. Very modern, large beds, nice bathroom - Breakfast buffet was good. Service there was great - cooks, wait staff, etc. We stayed for 8 nights so our waiter knew just how we liked our tea or coffee by day 2! - Conceirge handled our group tour bus and they did a fantastic job! - Perfect location just off Orchard Road. Close but far enough away that you didn't feel caught up in the 'busyness' of Orchard - Really good hamburger from room service! We loved property and if I could convince myself to fly the 13 hours to Singapopre (plus 7 to London), I would definitely stay here again!! Thank you Singapore Park View! Ps - We were out most of the day and therefore didn't hear noise from the renovations, other than the one free day we had. There was minimal disturbance in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: philpig
Reviews.Content: Stopped over in Singapore for one night on this trip. Found a good room rate on this hotel but wasn't quite sure how handy it was. On arrival, was pleasantly surprised by its convenient location. Very short walk to Orchard Rd shopping and dining strip. Rooms were adequate and staff were quite good. Unfortunately I had to catch a fairly early flight next morning and the breakfast only starts at around 6.30 or 7am, so that was a disappointment. The lobby bar is fairly average and had live entertainer but only fair. I would recommend this hotel for its location and if you get a good room rate it is very adequate for a stopover in Singapore. You have to pay for internet access, I thought it was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Family getaway”
Reviews.Author: RajivPuri
Reviews.Content: Hotel was under renovation (partly) which was not informed to us at the time of booking and check in. First noght was terrible, but hotel was quick to change our room next morning on request. Room was clean and decent size. not much activities for kids apart from swimming pool. Evening complimentary drinks were real bonus but morning breakfast was real let down. We stayed for 7 nights, same breakfast menu on all days. Hotel can do better than this Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and nice”
Reviews.Author: BangaloreBiztraveler
Reviews.Content: Very close to the heart of the city and nice, comfortable place

Reviews.Title: “Entertaining lounge singer”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here well aware the property is undergoing an extensive renovation. I never heard any noise during my three night stay at all. However, my biggest renovation related frustration was that many things were moved, so the signs indicating where the business center, vending and ice machines were, were all wrong. Check in was a little frustrating. I am Priority Club Platinum yet the front desk person tried to get me to pay extra for an "upgraded" room even though I should have receieved it on a complementary basis. After going back and forth, I finally was offered an "upgrade" which only meant the room had a newer look with white duvets and marble bath, but not an executive level room. Oh well... Location is great, just off Orchard Road with the Cuppage Center open air restaurant row just out the front door. Metro station a 5 minute walk. Best part was the lobby lounge. Nice bartender and a lounge singer that sang her heart out, bless her.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: jakmusic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 6 nights at the Holiday Inn Park View. It was the best service we have ever received from a hotel. We have a family of two adults and 2 kids (7 & 10). We were upgraded to a newly renovated premier room with two doubles. Good size room with a flat screen tv. The room was made and cleaned beautifully everyday by the same housekeeper, with a turndown service in the evening with chocolates. The staff were so friendly and always ready to help. The kids went for a swim in the pool, but said it was quite cold. We only ate breakfast once at the hotel, it was pretty good, had a good variety. But ate mostly in Orchard Road, as breakfast was not included in our hotel rate. Being very close to the MRT (about a 7 minute walk) was a bonus, otherwise taxis were always available outside the hotel. The staff warned us about the renovations at check-in but we never heard a thing. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: bwsSydney
Reviews.Content: We too have stayed at both the Atrium and the Parkview and prefer the latter, for location and amenities. We were one of the first visitors to the newly renovated floor, but like DavFam had issues with smoke lingering in room. However, we were then upgraded to the Executive floor for the 2nd time and much preferred the rooms there, unlike the visitor from Israel. As PC members, the staff cannot do enough for you! The Rooftop pool is brilliant but sadly, the spa was not operating at that time. The Orchid Room (?)restaurant is has an appealing menu and the staff are very attentive. We are heading back to the PV in April enroute to Vietnam-look forward to another warm welcome!!

Reviews.Title: “recommendable - Don't you just love Singapore?!”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Atrium before, which was pretty good (nice excecutive rooms). However, I wanted to try something else, and decided to give the Parkview a try. When checking in, and as a Platinum PC member I was given access to the Club room (which server free snacks between 18-20 every day), but the Club (excecutive?) floor didn't have such nice rooms - nothing like the pictures on the website at all! I asked to see if there was no mistake, and the nice chap at the checkin mentioned that so far there's only one floor which has been renovated - the coorporate floor on the third floor. He saw i was a little disappointed, and upgraded me a room on the third floor, which I was very happy about. Walking out of the elivator I couldn't believe my eyes. The whole floor looked amazing, with beautiful carpets, lights, and then when I walked into the room, I really felt like i was in an executive room - a flat screen, DVD player, alarm with iPOD dock, beautiful furniture, and bathroom; they really did a great job renovatint those rooms. The CLub lounge is very nice, with nice snacks (sushi, etc) and drinks. The breakfast is comparable to other 4/5 star hotels in Singapore - very high standard - all kinds of cold and warm foods, cereals, fresh fruit(drinks), etc. In the meantime I am very happy I've chosen this hotel. Especially worth it for PC members!! As far as I remember, the Atrium doesn't have any lounge/club so if this is what you're looking for, go for the Parkview.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel pitty about the smoking room”
Reviews.Author: davfam
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 with young kids. A really short walk past some lovely restaurants and you are on Orchard Road. The MRT is close eneough as well just get directions from the hotel. Booked two interconnecting rooms on executive floor. Great deals to be had on the holiday inn website especially if you take a chance and pay in advance. Hotel is perhaps a little dated but still very good considering the price compared with other hotels in Singapore. Breakfast was perfect. The rooms are nice and spacious. The swimming pool on the roof is also an absolute pleasure after a hot day touring. Only complaint was the stinky smoking room we had booked non-smoking. The hotel did try to relocate us but could find no interconnecting rooms so we put up with the smell. They did try air fresheners etc but to no avail. They really went out of their way on my wifes birthday decorating the room, a delicious cake and ice cream for the kids delivered by reception staff personally to our room at no charge at all! Very friendly staff, great location, comfortable accomodation and by Singapore standards a decent price make this a perfect place for tourists to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CutePhyllis
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Singapore with my parents and stayed in Holiday Inn Park View for 4 nights. I booked a room with two double beds which is quite satisfactory. We got a newly renovated room and the double beds were comfortable so that we didn't ask for an extra bed. The location of the hotel is very good. It is on the road behind Orchard Road and is about 5 minutes' walk from the nearest metro station. And another metro station which is the crossing station of two metro lines is about 10-15 minutes' walk from the hotel. The hotel has a roof top swimming pool. My parents like it very much. Overall, it's a nice hotel and I will choose to stay in it if I go to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wilpena56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in January for 3 nights on a stopover from Europe to Australia. Our family (2 adults and 2 children, 11 and 13) stayed in a newly renovated room with 2 double beds which were very comfortable. The kids enjoyed the rooftop pool, the only minus was that the pool water was rather cold. The breakfast buffet (which was not included in the room price) was fantastic and the kids ate for free, which was great value. The hotel location is also very attractive, right around the corner from Orchard Road, which is THE shopping mecca. There are also plenty of food courts, food stalls and the usual fast food places to be found. We would definitively stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: ArunJoshi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Holiday Inn for 3 days in Nov 08, and I would say, this is the best hotel I have ever been to,... The Hotel is in a perfect location, near to the city attractions, and the service is quite good. The rooms are very clean and neat. We have been given very clean towels, and many shampoos, creams and soaps. Pretty tall building we stayed in the 14th floor, and the views to the main road are very good. I went there on a business trip for three days, and the stay was fantastic. I had the time to go to the city and see the attractions as the hotel is near to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Artteachermum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 4 - kids aged 3 and 7. The room was quite spacious with 2 comfy double beds, a small table with 2 chairs and a desk. The location was excellent - close to Orchard Road and to Somerset MRT. Getting around is easy in Singapore as the public transport system is excellent. Taxis are reasonably priced too. We didn't eat at the hotel but did order room service a couple of times which was very tasty. My husband found a supermarket (Cold Storage) which is on the lower ground floor of the adjacent Centrepoint shopping centre. We bought disposable bowls, spoons and cereal for breakfast. There is a whole row of restaurants right next to the hotel serving anything from Italian to steaks to Chinese. I can recommend the Italian and the Chinese for delicious, reasonably priced food that kids will eat. The hotel room was quiet and the staff friendly. The best thing about the hotel was the pool - great for us and the kids! It has plenty of sun beds and tables - most in the shade too. Although the hotel is being renovated and we were told to expect a little disruption between 11.30 and 4, we heard absolutely no noise. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Somehow I liked the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Booked this through their website. Got a very good rate. Realised why when I got there. The hotel was under renovation. Between 10am and 6pm, the drilling and jackhammering can literally drive you nuts. Fortunately I was there for business and not for a leisurely nap! The room is very nicely apportioned and has a very comfortable feel. I did not try the breakfast at the hotel because my special room rate did not include this. There are many interesting food establishments just outside the hotel. You can even get a meal for SGD3. Although they name the hotel, Park View, you don't see much of a park. It should be Expressway View. Fortunately the thick sound proof windows are very effective. Location wise, superb. At the heart of Orchard Road shopping district and within a short walk to the subway station. Strangely, despite the ridiculous noise during the day, I quite like this hotel. I guess it was the good rate that i got it for, the location near to shops and food places, proximity to the subway and the nice melon scented soap they provide!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sanandal
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore during Christmas this year and stayed at Holiday Inn. It was the perfect place to stay in Singapore. It is right next to Orchard Road. So, all the action in Orchard Road are easily accessible. Transportation is a breeze since Dhobikaut is just 5 - 7 minutes walk away. There are plenty of restaurants around. This hotel has an excellent Indian Restaurant. Pluses - Location - Very friendly staff - Terrific breakfast. Kids eat free - Free additional bed for kids - Wallet friendly - Spacious rooms - Very clean - Numerous goodies as gifts during Christmas - Terrific restaurant - Accessibility to restaurants, shops, Trains etc - Constant supply of room supplies - Constant room service availability - List keeps going on..... Overall, if I travel to Singapore again, I know where I am going to stay next time. - Very good

Reviews.Title: “Very Average for the price”
Reviews.Author: oztravelers1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Park View on 2 occasions (on our way to Malaysia, and on our return to Australia). On the return journey we booked through Wotif.com. and received a reasonable price. One thing to be aware when booking with this Hotel - if you book on the same day via Wotif.com and its a weekend the Hotel apparently cant verify your booking (even when you have a confirmation printout!!!! as their own booking office is closed).....one staff member tried to charge us again and at a higher price and wouldnt acccept the printout confirmation!!!!! And his attitude was not customer friendly. The front desk seemed to get more upset when you asked for the manager on duty to sort out the problem. We eventually demanded to see the manger on duty. Eventually the Manager came out and cleared things up but it certainly left a bad bad taste in our mouth. The Hotel room itself is ok - we utilised the Executive Level on the way home but it wasnt up to the standard of a Hotel Executive Level in Cambodia we had just been too and stayed, the food, variety and service level just is not there compared to other hotels in the Executive Level price range. The package we booked not only included the executive level but also added extra's. We ended up having to chase the extra's up as they did not come to the room either. All in all a clean Hotel - Close to Orchard Street and the shopping - But You Pay For It both in dollars and lack of customer service from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Mickytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my last 2 nights of my Holiday and booked into the holiday inn through its website.Arrived from Bali in the afternoon and checked into the hotel and as priority club member was upgraded to club room with access to the club floor which was very nice of them.The room was very good much better than the Holiday Inn Atrium but this was a club room after all.Club floor access was very good with free breakfasts internet access and a very good cocktail lounge between 6 and 8 pm with free drinks and food.The next day as the sun was out i tried the swimming pool which was good but not exceptional and a nice way to relax on a sunday aftenoon.The location of the hotel is just behind Orchard road so is great for shopping and some nice barsand restaurants nearby in Cuppage Plaza .Singapore and Orchard road looked very good as they had just turned on the christmas lights .The Holiday Inn obliged with a late check out at 4 PM which was very good as i had an overnight flight to catch if i was in Singapore i would stay here again as it was convenient for everything in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in the end of November. The check in was not as smooth as it should have been, we arrived at 1430hrs which was well past when checkin time, to be advised our room was not ready and would not be ready until 1600hrs. We were then told that there was renovation going on, which I was not happy about as I had not been informed of this. finally after about 20 minutes we were able to get a room on the other side of the building to the renovation and instead of being the next floor up from it where they wanted to put us we were 3 floors up. The staff were polite and helpful when needed. The room was not great - basic room small and no good view but the bed was comfortable. The hotel location is the best thing going for it, it is right in the middle of orchad road and is a 1 minute walk to this road. it is a 5 minute walk to the nearest MRT and the bus stop is just on the corner. We were not at the hotel too much as we were constantly out and about sight seeing as Singapore is an amazing city. I would fully reccommend this hotel to anyone going to singapore that doesnt have the money for the marriott. It is a good hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Promising start - Disappointing end”
Reviews.Author: Shloime
Reviews.Content: The location is very good . We were leaving in the morning so we did not suffer from the noisy works which was heard above our room. On the departure day we left the baggage in the baggage room , and found afterwards that an expensive set of eye glasses is missing from one of the bags. A complaint was sent to the hotel manager who politely answered that they investigated it with no results. Be careful while leaving bags there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Erubin
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, it is well located, the hotel staff it is very helpfull the room very clean. Very close to shops and restaurants. The private transfer from the airport to hotel it cost USD 25,00 per person or you can get a free shuttle to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value club rooms”
Reviews.Author: IIliketogo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in a club room at the beginning of October. This gives the facility of using the club lounge at breakfast and more importantly in the evening for cocktails and snacks. And also a later checkout time. The only drawback of the club rooms is that there are no rooms allocated for non smokers. The room I was allocated smelt strongly of smoke so I asked for a move. That turned out not to be possible, but the staff were very accommodating bringing a plug in air freshener. That combined with max A/C and opening the window resolved the issue. The hotel location is fine. Very near to Orchard Road. Also there is a small street, Cuppage row, between the hotel and Orchard Road which has a good selection of restaurants and wine bars. The pool is on the rooftop and is well equipped. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: janandmabel
Reviews.Content: I had better expectations from this hotel. First of all, since they were renovating, the hammering and banging noise were unbearable. Finally, we got transferred to another room where there were no renovations nearby. However, much to my dismay, my new next door neighbor was a family of two children that wailed throughout the four nights I was there. The walls are just too thin that it felt like there were no walls at all. I could not sleep until the infant and toddler next door were asleep as well. Secondly, the bathrooms were old and a bit dirty. The drainage was a bit stuck up and so the water would easily make a pool at my feet when I am showering. The bathrooms definitely need updating. Thirdly, internet service at the business center was super expensive!!! I used it only for around 5 mins but the staff there charged me 4x that amount!!! After I complained to the front desk, they made the appropriate adjustment to my bill. I must say though that I could not have found a more courteous and helpful staff. Despite it not being a 5-star hotel like the Shangrila, the staff were very accomodating. Overall, for the price they charged, I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: What is good here is the rooms are fairly well decorated & fresh, the beds are comfortable, TV is flat, shower is great, room service is on time, the staff try hard & the lifts are fast! Also, the location is quite good, within 2 blocks of the bottom of Orchard Road & the subway. A bit of a walk to the main shops but that is ok. On the other hand, the rest of the hotel is a little run down & needs renovating & the service & facilities are sort of not quite there yet. The DVD player in the room did not have a power cable (!), Internet access is very expensive, my room key expired 1/2 way through the visit & several other small, individually insignificant things. I enjoyed my stay there ... but it could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Family”
Reviews.Author: Shell05
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on our way to Phuket and were very happy. The only reason I booked this hotel was because they would accommodate our family of 5, with the kids aged 8, 12 & 14, in one room. Which I only found out about because of Trip Advisor. I contacted various travel agents and hotel sale websites who said they would only take 4 so I went direct to the hotel who answered all my emails promptly and assured me 5 was no problem and it wasn't.. The room was big enough for us all but you wouldn't want to have an extended stay with that many in the room but as we were out and about it was perfect. The hotels location is excellent, a short walk to Orchard Rd and close to the MRT and there are plenty of hawker stalls nearby for a great feed. Breakfast was wonderful, plenty of everything, you could even get freshly made juices with whatever you wanted. The roof top pool was also great, we had trouble getting the kids out of it! The spa was also very relaxing but the on/off buttons needed replacing as it was very hard to turn it on. There were renovations going on and we were told about this from my first contact with them. They reminded us of that at check in and gave us 2 MP3 players to compensate for any disturbance we may have. Saying this we didn't hear a thing the whole time we were there. So all in all if we return to Singapore we will definately stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “same old place.”
Reviews.Author: busrider777
Reviews.Content: same old problems every time i stay here. the staff are willing but the focus on the customer is a little blurred. the new rooms are nice, but will it stay this way. i doubt it. the kind of place you can stay for a few days. anything longer, please try somewhere else.. the pool is grotty, the breakfast dull, but i think the ants like it. the staff get bored quickly and are not very focused. seem to forget that we , the public ,are paying for a reasonable service.

Reviews.Title: “OK Short Stay Business Traveller Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingaRich
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 29th & 30th September 2008. Good points: - Competitive price - Close to shops & town centre - OK Short Stay Business Traveller Hotel Bad Points: - No Park & no View! - Breakfast not exciting - no cheeses food luke warm coffee bad - Safe not anchored to the wall! - Pool could be cleaner / jacuzzi broken / gym steamed up - Hair dryer hidden in a drawer - No computer provided for internet access in the room - Noise from side street bars late into the night!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here again”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel again, was here about 2 months ago. This time I tried the executive rooms. Must say there isnt any much difference between the deluxe and executive rooms except for the free laundry service that we didnt use. Housekeeping is still excellent, it is even better than Intercontinental in bugis junction. The breakfast spread on the executive lounge (7th floor) is not as good as the 2nd floor. Toilet is the same as the deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little bit too old”
Reviews.Author: bobbyBangkok
Reviews.Content: It's my second time staying there after my first time more than 10 years ago. From the decoration I think they have done many renovations already but it seems to me that they are doing it again soon. It's just about time to do it again as now everything is quite used up. I stayed on the Club floor but the room was quite smelly and the carpet was too hard. The bathroom is still clean but overall it's just too old. I paid almost 300 SGD but don't feel that it's worth it. One good thing is that the staffs were quite well trained and the best thing always is it's location which is next to the Orchard St. I might go back again if the renovation is finish.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jpfree2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Parkview for 2 nights on 4th and 5th Sept 2008. This is a great hotel for families - we stayed in a single room (2 adults and 2 children aged 11 and 8). Staff are very helpful and friendly and check-in was accomplished in less than 5mins. We were pleased to receive a late check-out at 6pm. Our room was excellent - plenty of room for 4 people for a couple of nights. The view over the park was very pretty and nice to wake up to each day. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was fantastic - everything you could possibly think off was provided including coffee to order. The location was good - a short walk to Orchard Rd and the Somerset MRT. We used a combination of taxis and MRT and found the transportation really easy to use. The pool and gym facilities are good - a little oasis on the roof. Overall we found this to be an excellent place to stay in Singapore - particularly for children.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved the Holiday Inn Parkview”
Reviews.Author: reseacher101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two pre-teen children for a week (my husband was not with us) and we loved it! The room was extremely clean and comfortable and a great value. The rooftop pool was lovely. The food was great. The staff was delightful and extremely child friendly. The location was excellent. Our stay was absolutely wonderful! Great for families!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but under refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Park View Singapore 8th - 10th July 2008, I had already upgraded to the Executive floor prior to arrival and on arrival we were informed that the hotel was mid refurbishment and there would be some noise while the work was carried out. We were shown to our room on the fourth floor and the noise was unbearable, we immediately requested to be moved. No problem, we were then re-elocated to the seventh floor, this was slightly better but the noise got increasingly worse between 9.30am - 5.30pm so we stayed out of the hotel until that time. Apart from that we had no problems with the hotel, the extra cost involved in the upgrade to the Executive floor was well worth the S$60 (Approx £23) per room per night. Complimentary full english/ continental breakfast, internet access. Complimentary evening drinks, beer, wine, cocktails and light buffet was also served between 6.00pm to 8.00pm every evening. Considering a continental breakfast alone in the hotel cost S$20 (Approx £8.00) per person the cost of the upgrade was money well spent. The rooms were of a good size, beds were very comfortable, nice clean linen and ample good quality towels in the bathroom. Located just off Orchard Road its perfectly placed for the shops. The nearest MRT station is Somerset which is about a 5 minute walk away. This has to be the best transport for getting aroung Singapore and inexpensive if you purchase an EZ link card. The MRT System is very similar to the London underground system, and all signs and announcements are in English. Once in your room there are letters informing you of the times and dates of the work being carried out, (a little late when you've already booked in) the first of four phases of work is being carried out 2nd July to 2nd August 2008 between 10am - 6pm Monday to Saturday. Beyond those dates I suggest you contact the hotel directly. The exterior of the hotel is also being cleaned between 23rd June to 15th August, this doesn't create any problems as they are only pressure washing the walls and windows. A good hotel receiving the refurb it deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Happytiler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as my usual hotels were either fully booked or exorbitant prices due to the various trade fairs. Room was very dated but adequate. The club floor was quite basic although the staff were friendly. You can definitely get better hotels in Singapore if you are prepared to pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “That good... we went on the way back!”
Reviews.Author: SBetter765
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Park View hotel based on a recommendation and probably the main reason, that they could accommodate my family of 5. (2 adults, 2 children (3 + 6) and our baby who was just 1 before we went). We had booked to stopover there on the way to Oz and the way back (proved to be good move!) Before we left the UK, the hotel had responded very well to emails I had sent them. They answered all our questions and were able to satisfy an earlier checkin time (after a long flight!) and a cot in our room. Even though we were unable to book 2 adults, 2 children + baby on the website (could only say 2 adults) the hotel confirmed that a Deluxe Double room would satisfy our requirement... and they were right. We arrived very early, about 8am local time.. after a 12 hour flight all we wanted was a nice bath and bed, especially the younger members of the party! Though the hotel could not promise us a room on arrive (norm. checkin is 2pm), when I had emailed them before our arrival, they did say that they would free a room asap. They did exactly that, we wait for about an hour and we were very happy with that! The hotel is in walking distance (2-3 mins) of the main shopping/east street Orchard Road and the large Centre Point shopping Mall. We were able to grab some breakfast at McDonalds (Not our normal eating establishment!! but was the only thing open that early) before heading back for a lovely sleep! The hotel staff were excellent, from the moment we arrived (baggage, checkin, room service etc) they all made a fuss of the children but were very pleased to help. The staff attending your room (baggage, room service etc. do hang around expecting tips, but then that’s normal for a large hotel of this kind. The room was as we expected large enough for 2 double beds and a cot, plus 3 large suitcases and hand luggage. It sometimes felt cramp but then there was 5 of us in the room as well as all the baggage! It was nice and cool, the A/C was actually quite good and easy to use. Both times we had a fairly nice view of lots of greenery across a busy road and the girls enjoyed watching the different cars go past (yes, they thought that was great!) The room was very clean and maybe it could of done with fresher decor but it was still fine. The TV comes with a number of channels (2/3 kids channels thank goodness!) and tea/coffee. We had room service for the children a couple of times (pizza, chicken nuggets/fish and chips) which we thought was very good quality and good value for money. (surprising for a hotel) Quite large portions too. The Swimming poor is excellent, again especially for children. A small pool for little children and then a large very suitable poor for the rest! It's very clean though goes deep suddenly. so watch out! Also is a little slippy so no running! (as we found ourselves saying!) It's open early in the morning until 11pm.. nice after a late checkin (like on our return trip) and the lights make the pool look lovely. There are plenty of comfortable sun beds around the pool, including some in the shade. Only down side was that its not easy to order pool side food/drinks... plenty of menus.. no one to take orders! We just took drinks/snacks with us that we had purchased locally (at half the price!) Worth pointing out that as well as the pools, there are saunas, Jacuzzi, showers, nice Gym (with all the mod cons) and of course nice clean large towels! Breakfast is well worth having, lots of choice for the all (cereals, toast, eggs, meat.. you name it they have it) Worth also mentioning that kids don't pay for breakfast.. just the adults. For a large hotel it still felt personable... t was Mothers Day whilst we were there and after arriving back from Singapore Zoo (a real must!) there was a knock on the door.. it was a couple of very smartly dressed hotel staff (maybe even the manager.. don't know) with a large chocolate cake and some small cream cakes for the mum! It was a lovely surprise and very welcome.... shame mum does not like cakes! (but the kids and I did enjoy them!) To summarise... large hotel that caters for both business and leisure visitors (fine for both), very comfortable, even luxury. Great for kids (with nice meals that they will eat, pool and TV!) and nice fab for parents and pushchairs! 20 mins from the airport... We would definitely go back again... and probably will soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jo_A12
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Singapore and Holiday Inn Park View made it a memorable experience. Our luggages were being taken care of before we even paid the cab! Check in was a breeze and the staff were accommodating and friendly. Our bags were brought to our rooms within minutes of entering and surveying the area. The guest room was great. I was very particular with bathrooms and toiletries. The one in our room was superb! Very clean and just the right size. Towels were clean and crisp. Toiletries were complete. Kudos to Housekeeping! The buffet breakfast was worth the price. There were a variety of choices of Asian and Western food. There was a pool on the 8th floor.... a gym, a jacuzzi and sauna.... Staying there after a day of sightseeing was relaxing. The small bar just off the lobby served good drinks. The hotel was walking distance from Orchard Road and the MRT-Dhoby Ghaut Station. Near the hotel was Centrepoint Mall where you can buy essentials. Lots of restaurants there, too. The streets in the hotel vicinity were safe to be on even at night. We had an early morning flight out of the city and the hotel helped us with the transfer to the airport. The fee was reasonable and the driver was punctual. If i found myself in this part of the world again, I would stay at Holiday Inn Park View where i can feel safe and at home.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: dr_amjad
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore to attend a conference and stayed here for 3 nights in April. This was my 3rd visit to Singapore. The hotel is placed extremely close to the middle of orchard road. About 3 minutes by walk. Check in was quick and I was in my room in a few minutes after entering the hotel. The hotel staff were efficient and courteous throughout my stay. I stayed in a Deluxe room. The room was very clean, spacious and quiet.The bathroom was clean too and adequate. (Very important!). The view outside my room wasnt great (was overlooking an alley), but I have no complaints against that since I wasnt there on vacation. I don't think most visitors to Singapore should be spending much time in their room, since its such a vibrant city to explore. The hotel didnt seem to be very crowded. They have a bar which wasn't very crowded on the weekend nights, with live music. I didnt sample the hotels, but did order room service on one occasion... the food was average, but not too bad. In summary, a very nice hotel. I would definitely recommend it for the business traveller. Hard to find much wrong with it!

Reviews.Title: “Was Great in a Pinch”
Reviews.Author: RLMUK
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel last minute with no reservation as we needed to spend one more night in Singapore before we could fly home. The First impression of the hotel walking through the doors is good, the reception area/lobby is decorated very nicely creates a nice welcome. The reception staff were very helpful and very friendly. They convinced us to upgrade to an executive level room which was worth the dosh. It included free drinks in the evening between 6 and 8 if i remember correctly, free internet, and breakfast in the morning. The room was quite dated but comfortable enough, can't say is was impressed, but no major complaints. The staff in the executive lounge were brilliant, i never had an empty glass and they were always there ready to serve. The location is good, right off Orchard road and close to all the shopping you sould want. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Class at a great location”
Reviews.Author: agconrad
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 1 AM local time, had a smiling face waiting to open the door and carry my bags directly to my room. check in took all of about 1 minute and I was able to get right to bed. Had a beautiful view from a very nice room on the 8th floor executive level. I highly recommend upgrading to this level for a couple bucks more a night because the use of the executive lounge is well worth it for conducting business meetings and breakfast and happy hour with decent sushi, Tiger Beer, and a truly delectable Cabernet. Your within two blocks of Orchard Street shopping and nightlife. If you head that way and go across Istana Park to the English Pub directly behind the hotel. Great place to catch a night cap and watch some Rugby or Football(Real Football not the American stuff). I highly recommend getting a tall Kilkenny draft from the makers of Guinness, can't get it here in the States, but really a great brew! All in all, great service, decent price and overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Grt Indian Food & Location”
Reviews.Author: docviki
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price, wonderfull experience, ideal for indian travellers as indian restraunt is very nice , shopping is next door on orchard street ,nice rooms & pool will stay agin next time also.............

Reviews.Title: “good location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Raz1260
Reviews.Content: booked in to executive 7th floor with park/motorway view. this floor just has executive rooms- good size. floor has its own front desk, private breakfast room, free bar and snacks in the evening and generally you're looked after. rates about £80pn which i though was good value. location is just behind orchard rd and abt 2 mins walk to middle of orchard rd. 2 hawker food places near by and plenty of shops. 5 mins walk to 2 different mrt lines. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LancashireSam
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in the Holiday Inn and what a superb 2 nights they were. The check in was brill, no fuss, no hanging around, very nice and cheerful staff. What a beautiiful lobby with a big chandeliar, it was great. The room was very large with everything in that you would expect. The bathroom was quite large and everything was spotlessly clean, not a speck of dust anywhere. The bed was enourmous, king size plus half again. The breakfast was nice, a buffet breakfast with choice of cold and hot food and plenty of it. Again, the tables and the staff were very friendly. In fact only complaint we had was that the bar was expensive, but I suppose that is to be expected, but having said that not even 3 minutes away there were a couple of bars where you could sit and have a drink. There was a pool with great facilities which we used, again towels provided for the pool area, which is really good especially as this is not advertised in any of the brochures or internet sites, something to bear in mind. Would definitely go back there and would certainly recommend it whether you are a couple of have kiddies, superb hotel. Very close to Orchard Road, the main shopping area, but you could hear a pin drop in the evening it was that quiet. Absolutely fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “The Plot was Lost”
Reviews.Author: Kezsin
Reviews.Content: Since our first stay with the H.Inn Parkview, we have been continously coming back to this fine Hotel. This time our experience was different. We booked for 2 rooms over the hotel website, and requested for a connecting room. I followed up with an email requesting that the connecting room to be located on a non-smoking floor. Just so that we wanted to make sure all was in order, my wife called the hotel and they sounded surprised of our request. In their system, it was 2 rooms on different floors, and they cannot quarantee a non-smoking room. Fortunate for us, the 3-hour notice was sufficient to reserve a connecting room, but was a smoking-floor. Permitted since we really wanted a connecting room. We were assured that the staff will clean and air the room - though it was done only for 1. The other room was not made up - and there were empty cups of tea and bottles lying on the carpet. The odour was heavy of a smoker, and the bed was clearly not made up. This discovery, after being handed the keys much later in the afternoon. To say the least, we felt offended. The shower head was not working well, and despite our several calls, an engineer was dispatched to rectify the shower. It worked - but only for a while. The subsequent calls were ignored. Perhaps they thought that it was fixed. We certainly did not enjoy our stay as compared to the previous visits. And I made sure the Hotel Management knew of our complain through their Feedback Forms. I only hope that they will attend to this query, or otherwise a fine hotel would have lost its plot in becoming a potential top spot. I must also add that the front-desk officer did his best to explain the "situation" together with a Complimentary offer of an additional house-drink by virtue of being a Priority Member did some good PR mileage - albeit left to the last minute before our checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous oasis in the heart of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: family-mcbirnie
Reviews.Content: Flew into Singapore at 5am and decided to catch the MTR (rail) from the airport station to kill some time before attempting a check in or at least leaving our bags until official check-in time at the hotel of 2pm. The cost of the MTR was only $1.70 sing ($2.70 less $1 refund on 'recycling' your ticket at the end station) each as compared to approx $18 by taxi! - an efficient ½hr - 35 min by train , although it needed a quick change across the platform at 2 stations. The closest MTR stop is Somerset - with the hotel direction well sign-posted at the station. Crossing Orchard Rd, it was only 2 blocks to the right and a minute up a side-street where the hotel is on a parallel road: maybe 4-5 minutes walk at the most. Easy if you don't have a lot of bags. Staff were wonderful; checked us in right away at 8am; so we could have a shower, a drink (free bottled water/ hot tea/ coffee) and a rest before heading out again to explore. There are 2 Indian 24 hr restaurants and convenience store outside the hotel, but at 7.30 - 8am the food street which is adjacent to the hotel starts bustling for the breakfast crowd. The food street consisting of 2 food courts, food stalls and about 6 full-service restaurants - no need to venture further. Quiet room, large beds, large rooms, 3 minutes to Orchard Rd and pub transport to Singapore's tourist sights, what more could you want or need?

Reviews.Title: “An affordable hotel along Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: Check-in was done at the Executive Floor and was completed promptly. As I got a room at Corporate Club Floor, I was given a upgrade to a Junior Suite. Was able to enjoy free cocktails and food at the Club Room. However, the staff at the Club Room ignored us. Staff at the hotel seems to treat caucasians and tourists better. Guess it is a problem at all local hotels. Location is quite good as it is quite near the MRT station. There are shopping centres (Plaza Singapore and Centre Point) near the hotel too. There is a Cold Storage at Centrepoint Shopping Centre where you can buy your daily necessities. The eateries around the area serve nice local food. Rooms was nice and the bed was great. The hotel is kind worn out (old) and there were some problems with the basin. The bathtub was big but the shower was working very well. Most of the rooms probably face the expressway so dun expect a good view. Prices are pretty decent for the location, and the quality of the rooms. Breakfast was ok with a decent spread of Asian and Western food. However. the dining area was crowded and had to wait a while before getting our seats. The staff at the dining area (except for lady at the reception) was not friendly, probably they were too busy clearing the tables. Overall, it was not a bad stay. Was disappointed that a copy of newspaper was not provided to me despite the fact I was staying in a junior suite. Nevertheless, if you are looking for a hotel near Orchard Road and affordable, do check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Stopovers”
Reviews.Author: Fester1
Reviews.Content: Cant speak too highly of this hotel booked a family room directly with them - rooms were good (views were not that appealing though) Breakfast excellent likewise pool and gym facilities the best thing for us though was that the hotel were quite happy to store our bags for 4 days even after we had checked out to go on another trip out of Singapore

Reviews.Title: “A central location overlooking the park”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Park View for five days in August. Our previous favorite, the Phoenix Hotel, was closed for renovations, and the Holiday Inn is similarly close to the Somerset MRT station, Cold Storage Supermarket, and our favorite shopping areas. Ten years ago the rooms were small, but now they are large. We were pleased with the comfort of the bed, size of the room TV channels, the concierge, front desk, and the bathroom. We left an ice pack with them, and it was retrieved quickly from their freezer when we checked out. Other hotels, such as Orchard Parade, are providing free wireless Internet, but the Holiday Inn charges either 55 cents a minute or $25 for a full 24 hours, so we used dial-up because phone calls are inexpensive. The hotel is owned by Harilela Holdings, so we reasoned that the hotel's Tandoor North Indian restaurant would be excellent, and it was. As Singapore hotels become increasingly expensive, the Holiday Inn is an excellent value, and we expect to return to the Tandoor Restaurant and the Holiday Inn again. Both exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: vetoevo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times on business, so when the family and I had a holiday in Singapore we chose this hotel. Well positioned, near shops and restaurants. They have a good Indian restaurant on site. Breakfast, like most H-Inn's is a bit overpriced so we skipped that. Rooms a good size, clean in HI style. Great arrival, treated very well. At check-out the girl made some errors and didn't apologise, just typed away until they were no longer on the bill. But very good value for money - we'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good standard business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sergio2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in August 07. Hotel: well laid-out, a typical business hotel. Not new but appears to be well maintained. Location: a block behind Orchard Road, it is close to the shopping action. Major malls and department stores such as Takashimaya, Paragon and Wisma Atria are at walking distance (five to 10 minutes walk). Room: good size room, clean, well appointed with minibar, TV with 25 channels, electronic safe, writing desk, wardrobe, coffee and tea making equipment, small couch. Lots of lights. Good King-size bed which was comfortable. Two small bottles of complimentary drinking water supplied. The air conditioning was working well. The well-lit, marble-clad bathroom had a shower over large bath tub. The room had no view (facing a building across the road). Restaurants: due to the proximity of Orchard Rd, we did not try any of the restaurants at the hotel for any of the meals. Staff: all staff we encountered were friendly and smiling, reception was friendly and efficient. Booking: had booked the hotel through the hotel chain's website, as it did not appear to be available on discount sites. Paid SGD 166 per night for Friday and Saturday, and SGD 258 for Sunday (same room, but Friday/Saturday was a weekend special; this was a rate that had to be booked at least five days in advance). Internet access: in-room Internet access (available wired or wireless - the user chooses) costs SGD 28 per 24 hours which I find relatively expensive, particularly in a high-tech city such as Singapore which in my opinion should have free wireless available throughout the city, although this pricing level appears to be the norm in four-star hotels these days. The wired access was truly high-speed however; wireless signal in our room appeared to be fairly weak (two out of five bars). Conclusion: whilst not remarkable in any particular way, a good hotel for its price in Singapore, at a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Average to Above Average BUT Absolutely mindblowing Indian Restuarant..Tandoor!”
Reviews.Author: xq22
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel online for what appeared to be a good rate considering the location. Stayed there for 6 nights in July 2007 Cant find fault with the location, very central adjacent to the Centrepoint Mall on Orchard Road a stones throw from the Somerset MRT. Location is one reason I might consider staying there again. The more compelling reason to return to stay here would be the absolutely fabulous Indian restuarant Tandoor. We ordered room service on the last day(Tadka daal and Paneer Makhanwaala) and it was the best room service food I have had in all my travels( am a bit of Gulliver myself;) Room sizes arent that huge, but not a pigeon hole either. fairly OK. Like Singapore..clean and functional. Hotel service was variable, the conceirge was a very friendly desk while the reception and front desk either was perpetually confused, just plain inefficient, or more alarmingly for the hospitality industry ..they were constantly indifferent! left a lot to be desired . a compuslory course on understanding human relations might be of help. Incidentally, we returned late on one of the evenings to find our beds hadnt been made, towels not replaced, etc, inspite of having personally informed the concerned staff while leaving the hotel for our day out...but the duty manager saved the day/night by shifting us (wife +2kids) to another room on the same floor fairly quickly Not much of a view from either rooms, so dont go by the name! All in all, I have stayed in better Holiday Inn's though this one can really be up there if they recognise they have problems in service and appropriately address it. Lots of things going for them, probably accounting for the complacency!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit still great”
Reviews.Author: dmrres
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to this hotel and no change, thats not in a bad way, staff great check in easy and the food fantastic again best to book bead and breackfast (good deal) i would go as far to say one of the best breackfast i have had. the pool well you can't fault it fantastic. best deal book direct with holiday inn at least 4 weeks in advance if you can, I have booked again and will be going back this year 2007 before heading off to Dubai. Hope this helps ( ver Close to Orchard road)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammy66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a couple of nights here,and loved it! We arrived at breakfast time after a long journey from Nepal, via Delhi, and feeling very bedraggled.. We tentatively asked whether our room was available. We were promptly taken upstairs to the executive floor,where we were not only given a room, but upgraded to a suite! Ths was a superb room, with an immensely comfortable bed. Free drinks, separate breakfast, and free use of business facilities, all in the executive lounge. Staff very friendly, and food good. Very good locatiion, close to Orchard Street - shopping, and pick up for SIA tour bus (wel worth using)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Kezsin
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the Holiday Inn Phuket, the Parkview Holiday Inn has some recognisable and familiar sights - especially where the toiletries are concerned. The Hotel is great for walking along Orchard Road. A tip - walk out towards Tanglin in the morning before it gets too warm (shops open at 10 am), and then start shopping (or rather walking) back towards the hotel, which is behind Robinsons Centrepoint. Check out the pool on the 8th floor. Checking in was a breeze too - and very friendly staff. The only constructive remark I have is the number of housekeepers who cannot speak good English. A really good stay otherwise - and quite discreet.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel near Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: Coza
Reviews.Content: My Wife and Myself and 2 children stayed at this hotel as a stopover on our way to Europe. On the 23rd of December traveling from Australia we stayed here, the rooms were on the small side and the overall feel was the hotel was on the tired side, needs a bit of work. Booked a non smoking room but did not get it, to tired to argue about it. Lovely roof top swimming pool and reasonable breakfast 40$ Sing) children ate free. Good location backing onto Orchard Rd and cost $15 by taxi from airport to get there. On our return trip from Europe the hotel had our reservation but no room 24th Jan 07 so they put us in Intercontinental which was a much nicer hotel. My feelings were it was a reasonable hotel for the price but nothing special.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre
HotelInfo.Address: No.11 Cavenagh Road, Singapore 229616, Singapore
